programme.title: Diseñando tu amor
programme.desc: Dos hermanas con un gran anhelo de superación y personalidades opuestas buscan triunfar en el mundo de la moda, una quiere tener su propio taller, mientras que la otra desea ser modelo internacional. Ambas encontrarán el amor en un mismo hombre.

programme.title: Si nos dejan (?)
programme.desc: Alicia Montiel cree que tiene a su lado al amor de su vida y a la familia perfecta, hasta que se entera de que su esposo, Sergio Carranza, le ha sido infiel por varios años. Sin embargo, Martín nuevamente le devolverá a Alicia, la ilusión en el amor.

programme.title: La hija del embajador
programme.desc: Sancar es hijo de un pobre leñador y Nare es hija de un embajador. Mientras crecía, Sancar aprendió sobre el mundo de Nare, mientras Nare aprendió sobre su país. Solo se veían dos días al año, pero nunca dejaron de pensar el uno en el otro.

programme.title: Mañana es para siempre
programme.desc: Gonzalo, padre de Fernanda, acaudalado hombre de negocios, no repara en las diferencias sociales, mientras su esposa Montserrat rechaza la amistad entre Eduardo y Fernanda, ya que Eduardo es hijo de una empleada de la hacienda.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Un amigo de Arturo es promovido como gerente general y Magda lo convence para que le dé un mejor puesto a Arturo. Luis tiene que vender mochilas y guarda las ganancias en una de ellas para que Pedro no lo encuentre, pero mientras él no está Pedro vende la mochila que tiene el dinero. Magda invita a los vecinos a una cena en su nuevo pent-house, pero mientras ven la tele descubren que el jefe de Arturo está involucrado en lavado de dinero.

programme.title: Familia P. Luche (?)
programme.desc: Cuando Ludovico es obligado a asistir al Funeral de un empleado de Industrias Camerino, Ludovico no sólo descubre que el muerto es un viejo amigo, sino también que éste tiene su reloj. Ludovico hará hasta lo imposible por recuperar ese reloj, al final descubre que Maradonio lo tenía.

programme.title: El gordo y la flaca

programme.title: Nosotros los guapos

programme.title: Los González

programme.title: Los González

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Chase decides to start his own candle business and Julie finds that her dream of opening up her own restaurant clashes with Todd's vision.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Todd gets roped into a boys trip to Universal Orlando for Grayson's birthday, and Julie teaches Chloe a lesson in sportsmanship before her first horse riding competition.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Todd tests Savannah's new boyfriend's intention when she brought him home. Later on, Chase and Savannah help Grayson with his math test.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Todd tries to teach Julie a lesson about keeping track of her jewelry after she loses another expensive piece. Meanwhile, Nanny Faye enlists Chase's help for a neighborhood porch competition.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Due to a work commitment, Julie must miss Chloe's Pre-K graduation while Todd takes over her duties. Savannah tries to prove to Todd she's ready for a new job in California.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Chase takes advantage of his dad's car when Savannah signs them up to babysit over Father's Day. Meanwhile, Grayson has trouble getting along with Savannah's boyfriend, Nic.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Todd gets himself into trouble when he gifts Chase a home that has already been promised to Savannah. Meanwhile, Julie likes the look of Allison's new swim instructor.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: As Todd closes in on 50, he decides to make amends. Meanwhile, Grayson thinks he's old enough to stay home alone.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Todd receives an alarming diagnosis. Grayson's broken phone fixes his money problems.

programme.title: Chrisley Knows Best
programme.desc: Julie forces Todd to host Chloe's first slumber party. Faye smells a rat.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. Mitchell and Cameron's big day arrives without a hitch, until their trip down the aisle turns out to be no walk in the park, which puts Pepper's wedding-planner skills to the ultimate test. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria host the Tuckers; Phil thinks he can visit an eye doctor before the ceremony; and Claire relishes her role as \"best woman.\".

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the Season 5 finale, the chaos of Mitch and Cam's wedding continues as the grooms grow discouraged; the guests are starting to get restless; and the whole ordeal takes a toll on Claire's physical and emotional state.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A happy and carefree summer in the Dunphy household comes to an end in the Season 6 premiere when Alex returns from a humanitarian mission. Meanwhile, Mitchell and Cameron get back from their honeymoon, but the latter is still feeling like a newlywed; and Gloria sends a message to Jay about his slovenly appearance.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Gloria's anniversary creates a dilemma when they can't decide what kind of gifts to give. Elsewhere, the Dunphys tag along on Alex's tour of Caltech, but Phil, Luke and Haley get wrapped up in a campus experiment, while Claire tries to convince her to go there; and Mitchell, Cameron and Lily pose for a new portrait for their mantel.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: While editing Mitchell and Cameron's wedding video, Phil discovers he's to blame for a miserable cold that's been plaguing the family. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria advise Manny on how to deal with the stress of high-school football, but Cameron can't decide how much playing time he should get; and Mitchell meets his intellectual match in Lily's new friend, Sydney.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys move into a hotel while their house is undergoing mold remediation, so Phil tries to put a positive spin on their involuntary bonding experience. Meanwhile, Gloria worries about Manny when he dates an older, popular girl; and Cameron is afraid that his team's winning streak could be jinxed by Mitchell.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is selling the house next door, and he and Claire can't wait to have new neighbors—until they encounter an obnoxious couple who might buy it. Meanwhile, Jay is irate to learn that the grandfather of Manny's girlfriend is his biggest rival in the closet business; and Mitchell and Cameron hear horror stories about Lily's teacher.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil takes over Halloween from a reluctant Claire and turns the Dunphy house into \"AwesomeLand.\" Meanwhile, Gloria chooses Princess Fiona and Shrek costumes for her and Jay, but he would rather go as Prince Charming—with a full head of hair. Elsewhere, Cameron can't keep up with the day's activities; and Mitchell delivers the closing argument in a big case, but the stenographer is dressed as a spider.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley and Andy start spending a lot of time together, but Phil and Claire aren't sure what to make of their relationship. Meanwhile, Gloria's desire for Manny to study Spanish instead of French prompts her to hire a handsome Spanish tutor; and Mitchell and Cameron meet a news reporter at a school function who takes an interest in one of their lives.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil cooks for Thanksgiving and enlists Luke as his sous-chef, but Claire secretly prepares another turkey when she doesn't trust them to get the job done. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria's holiday travel plans fall through, though they come to regret not telling anyone about it; and Cameron comes up with an unusual idea to make Lily wear a dress for dinner.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Alex tells her folks she has a boyfriend, but Phil and Claire suspect she made it up because they've put too much pressure on her. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria both have parties that neither of them wants to attend; and Mitchell lends a helping hand to a coworker, but his and Cameron's new couch may be a casualty of his altruism.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley turns 21 and the family decide to take her to a bar to celebrate, but Claire hopes her oldest daughter will start to see her as a friend instead of just her mom. Meanwhile, Jay and Phil's errand to pick up Haley's gift—a new car—takes a wrong turn; Mitchell and Cameron learn a tough lesson about themselves; and Alex, Luke and Manny babysit Lily, whose curiosity catches them off guard.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A brush with death on the way to breakfast has a major impact on the Dunphys, including Claire, who vows to be more carefree; Haley and Alex, who promise not to fight anymore; and Luke, who starts a bucket list. Meanwhile, Manny, who was also along for the ride, says he'll never get in a car again.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fed up with Ronnie and Amber's boat on their front lawn, the Dunphys strike back by calling on Phil's dad and his retired friends to help them prove a point. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria clash over Joe's potty training; and Cameron takes Lily to clown school, but doesn't tell Mitchell about it.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie caves in and calls up her \"go-to\" guy; Sam (Kim Cattrall) uncovers too much about her neighbor's between-the-sheets behavior; Miranda falls prey to a pushy partner; and Charlotte finds her dance card overbooked. Charlotte: Kristin Davis. Miranda: Cynthia Nixon. Carrie: Sarah Jessica Parker. Written by Darren Star.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie's romance with a writer ends up being a family affair, while Samantha (Kim Cattrall) takes on a strange bedfellow: Charlotte's brother. Miranda: Cynthia Nixon.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie (Sarah Jessica Parker) becomes her alcoholic beau's new addiction; Charlotte's ego takes a hit when her guy takes a nap during sex; and Samantha gets a strange request from her friends from the \"other team.\" Charlotte: Kristin Davis. Miranda: Cynthia Nixon. Samantha: Kim Cattrall.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: In the Hamptons, the ladies fear that women in their 20s are a \"threat to their existence\" as Charlotte (Kristin Davis) plays young to hook a guy; Samantha's ex-secretary moves into her territory. Meanwhile, Carrie gets a cloying intern (Rachel Miner) and a shock from Big. Brad: Patrick Breen. Nina: Marisa Ryan. Samantha: Kim Cattrall.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie's hopes of \"just being friends\" with Big (Chris Noth) are dashed by his shocking announcement about Natasha. Meanwhile, Sam has her hands full with \"Mr. Too Big\" (John Enos); and Miranda and an ex find friendship leading them back to bedmates. Charlotte: Kristin Davis.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie and friends wonder if women just want to be rescued, and they attend a firefighters' benefit to find out. Meanwhile, Steve (David Eigenberg) unnerves Miranda with his devotion; a local politician (John Slattery) wants more than Carrie's vote; and Charlotte sets her sights on the altar. Ricky: Mike Lombardi. Carrie: Sarah Jessica Parker. Miranda: Cynthia Nixon.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Apolitical Carrie hits the campaign trail with a handsome politician (John Slattery); Samantha stoops to connect with her new beau; Miranda and Steve (David Eigenberg) take their relationship to another level. Stanford: Willie Garson. Bob: Tommy Crudup. Mark: Mike Doyle. Greg: Donnie Keshawarz. Carrie: Sarah Jessica Parker. Samantha: Kim Cattrall.

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.sub-title: Attack of the Five Foot Ten Woman
programme.desc: Samantha tries to cash in on a well-kept secret about her masseur (Christopher Sieber); Miranda gets a new housekeeper (Lynn Cohen) who tries to tidy up more than her apartment; Carrie plans to show up Mr. Big's new flame. Natasha: Kathryn Bridget Moynahan.

programme.title: Reunion Road Trip
programme.desc: A first look at the new series Reunion Road Trip.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kim gives the world an intimate look into the busiest week of her life as she prepares for the birth of her fourth baby, stars in a music video with Paris Hilton, and heads to the Met Gala. Kourtney feels violated when she realizes someone close to her family has been stealing from her.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kim plans a surprise vow renewal ceremony for her husband to celebrate five years of marriage. When Kourtney's friends can't get along on a girl's trip to Turks and Caicos, she must assert herself to salvage the vacation.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: When Khloe's ex-husband Lamar releases a memoir that includes details about their relationship, she considers reconnecting with him for the first time in years. After an old rumor resurfaces, Kris worries that it will spark a fight between her and Khloe. Kim is nervous to speak at a live press conference at the White House. Scott thinks his dog has what it takes to win Best in Show.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kris is angry about the rumors that came out on her best friend's murder's anniversary; Kim is having a hard time detaching from her work while on vacation in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kim and Kourtney plan a joint birthday party for their daughters, but a disagreement over candy puts the special day in jeopardy. Kris is concerned about some of Khloe's obsessive behavior and enlists the help of a professional. After receiving criticism over the name of her shapewear line, Kim faces a difficult decision about the future of her company.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: When Tristan starts showering Khloe with gifts, she worries his grand gestures are an effort to win her back. After Kim and Kourtney learn that people are being sickened by toxic waste in a nearby community, they vow to help. Kris gives Khloe an unforgettable birthday present.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kim and Khloe are furious that Kourtney is hiding aspects of her life from the cameras and attempt to fire her from the show. Kim helps a young man recently out of prison with his future.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kris takes the family to Wyoming in an effort to ease recent tension and strengthen their bond, but her plan backfires when the girls start fighting on the trip. Kendall is excited to spend some much-needed bonding time with Kylie.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is afraid that the teenage Luke is starting to push him away, but Andy is ready to fill the void. Meanwhile, Jay has a dilemma when Joe may be allergic to Stella; and Mitchell does some freelance legal work at his father's closet company, where he frequently crosses paths with Claire.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys hatch another amorous adventure as Clive and Juliana for Valentine's Day, but Claire is afraid that Phil might be a little too into her alter ego. Meanwhile, a visit from Gloria's sister, Sonia, could spoil Jay's plans for a romantic evening; and Mitchell and Cameron get into a tricky situation with a friend.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil's long reunion weekend with his old cheerleading friends prompts Claire to lobby for a first-class seat on the flight home, leaving her husband in coach. Meanwhile, Gloria wants Jay to teach Manny how to stand up to a bully in his cooking class; and Mitchell, Cameron and Pepper throw a belated baby shower for Sal.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire's stuck at the airport and her computer is her lifeline when she's trying to contact Haley after a big fight, and the whole family gets involved in the online drama.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire shoot a commercial for Pritchett Closets to counter a rival's splashy ad, but dad and daughter have conflicting creative visions. Meanwhile, Phil, Luke and Manny try to take down a Peeping Tom's drone that's spying on a sunbathing Gloria; Cameron is nervous about Lily's performance in a school talent show; and Haley worries about Andy when he's rushed to the hospital with appendicitis.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire tackles spring cleaning, while Phil worries that Luke is getting better than he is at just about everything. Elsewhere, Haley tries to get Alex's mind off school by taking her to a music festival; and Gloria and Jay promise to give up their vices of Spanish soap operas and cigars, respectively, but it's easier said than done when Gloria attends Cameron's faculty talent show and Jay goes with Mitchell to pick up Lily at camp.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay's birthday comes with a number of interesting gifts, including Phil's high-tech outdoor grill, and Claire and Mitchell's offer to pay back some ancient loans—though they don't think he'll actually accept it. Meanwhile, Gloria teaches Manny and Luke a lesson about drinking; and Andy finds himself in an awkward situation when Haley brings her new doctor boyfriend.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam asks Jay to sub in on his bowling team for the finals, but doesn't make it clear that it's an all-gay league, which puts Jay in a precarious situation. Meanwhile, Phil and Claire are surprised by how much fun they have at dinner with their neighbors Ronnie and Amber; and Gloria and Mitch set out to prove they are still young and fun by agreeing to a night of clubbing with Haley.

programme.title: College Football 150
programme.desc: As much as any other sport, college football tells the history of race relations in America. From the early emergence of African-American players to the chronicle of integration and the belated advent of African-American quarterbacks and coaches, you can't appreciate the sport's complexities and conflicts without knowing how long the road has been – and continues to be – towards equal rights.

programme.title: College Football 150
programme.desc: College football has evolved in so many transformative ways. All throughout its history, the sport's constant evolutions have had common threads, with officials and coaches striving to make it safer, more exciting and more entertaining.

programme.title: College Football 150
programme.desc: Everything starts with the quality of the players that a school is able to recruit. And since college football's earliest days, recruiting has been one of the most critical and controversial aspects of the sport.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Four chefs from Guy Fieri's winning season of \"Food Network Star\" reunite in Flavortown 10 years later. Challenges include a five-star dish using a list of ingredients compiled by Guy. Later, an unexpected guest drops by with a special delivery; and a summer feast is prepared using items from the market's unpredictable sample tables.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: The market is turned into a midway so that four carnival food chefs can compete for a jackpot worth up to $20,000. First, they try their luck spinning a wheel of chance for the ingredients in their fried classic. Next, chefs play Guy Fieri's arcade favorite, Spree Ball, to determine the budget for their \"something on a stick\" specialty. Then, the final two chefs use darts to pop the balloons that determine which aisles they can shop to create elevated carnival food.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Four thrifty chefs are given only one five-minute shop and $60 to buy all the groceries to last them the entire competition. Dishes include a comfort classic breakfast; a spicy lunch; and a fried dinner.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy puts four chefs through three rounds of shopping and cooking from the frozen foods section. First, he asks for a meat and potatoes dish. In round two, he asks them to make their best lobster dish but throws them off with an ice block challenge. The remaining chefs must then make an international dinner by bowling for ingredients with a frozen turkey.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Flavortown has witnessed the creativity of countless chefs, and Guy Fieri wants to focus that creativity on one of his favorite foods: sandwiches. Guy brings four sandwich-making savants to Flavortown Market to test their skills between two slices of bread.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri brings back three pairs of rival chefs who previously faced off one-on-one. Two budget-brawlers settle the score in a round that has them shopping for ingredients under $5 for their family dinners.

programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. programme.desc: During a morbidity-and-mortality conference to determine who should be held responsible for a patient's death, J.D. and Turk recall leaving Sacred Heart to track down a cured patient (Jason Bateman) who owed J.D. a thank-you. Dr. Matthews: Jay Kenneth Johnson.

Mrs. Wilk: Michael Learned. Jason: Shaughn Buchholz.

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. The boy must figure out how to set things right, or risk completely altering the future.

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: A teen time-travels from 1985 to 2015 in order to save his parents and his children from the disasters precipitated by his own mistake when he traveled to 1955 and bought a book in order to enrich himself in the future.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A former music producer who had recently---and suddenly---converted to Hasidic Judaism collapses at her wedding, and House suspects that the reasons behind her sudden conversion might also have something to do with her mysterious illness. Meanwhile, Wilson is dating a woman whose personality is a lot like House's.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House suspects that an ER patient with a sunny disposition has a bigger problem than was initially diagnosed. The reason: He thinks the patient is too nice. Meanwhile, House and Amber (Anne Dudek) spar over face time with Wilson; and Cuddy demands House give his team performance reviews.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House believes that an actor (Jason Lewis) on his favorite soap opera is seriously ill after observing his symptoms on television, so he decides to intervene; Amber and Wilson have their first fight, much to House's delight; and Cuddy tries to keep up appearances when an inspector shows up unexpectedly at Princeton-Plainsboro.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: In Part 1 of the two-part fourth-season finale, House suffers head injuries in a bus accident that also injures dozens of others. Though dazed and confused and unable to clearly recall events prior to the crash, he has flashbacks in which he sees a fellow passenger exhibiting signs of a deadly illness. He can't recall who it was, but that's not going to stop him from trying. Bartender: Fred Durst.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part fourth-season finale, House remains held back by his bus-accident injuries as he struggles to recall the symptoms he noticed in a rapidly deteriorating fellow passenger just before the crash. House's cloudy memories from the accident also threaten his friendship with Wilson. Bartender: Fred Durst.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the disappearance of a congressional aide after a hitman saves her from two men posing as NCIS agents. Also, Lasalle struggles with life-altering decisions regarding his brother's future.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: During the annual Contraband Days pirate festival, the NCIS team investigates the murder of a Navy captain who was searching for a valuable 200-year-old marble and gold fleur-de-lis.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride, Sebastian and Tammy travel to South America after Pride is personally requested by a former colleague to assist with a classified operation that has been compromised.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Percy and Lasalle go undercover at a high-stakes, underground poker game after the organizer targets players with access to a naval research laboratory. Also, Laurel Pride visits her dad during spring break to discuss options after her upcoming graduation.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and his bar patrons, including Sydney Halliday, who is visiting Pride after leaving the Army, are held hostage by a group of volatile thieves.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Gregorio calls on Clair McGrady when the team's case matcher the one she studied during FBI training.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When journalist Oliver Crane posts a scathing article documenting Pride's \"reckless use of justice,\" the team is concerned about the fallout from the piece and the confidential information included in the story. Also, Rita Devereaux warns Pride that someone in D.C. has coordinated this attack on him, and the article is just the beginning.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. Pride assembles an off-the-books team to search for a loophole when he faces a grand jury indictment for abuse of power.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Conclusion. Pride and the team uncover a sinister plot during the New Orleans Tricentennial Fleet Week celebration. The Season 4 finale.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam plans to invite Dana to his laser-tag birthday party, but Barry thinks the game is juvenile and persuades Adam to host a make-out party in the basement instead. When Beverly finds out about the gathering, she tries to get Murray to intervene. Elsewhere, Pops and Murray get caught up watching the opening of Al Capone's safe on TV.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly and Murray try to console Erica after a bad breakup. Elsewhere, Barry becomes hooked on a new arcade game.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Carter's plan to help an ailing doctor (Edward Asner) leads to a dead-end---and a decision about his own career path; Pratt intervenes after a burglary lands Leon's pal in the ER, along with the cop he shot; Kerry's ethics are tested even further while setting up a photo-op for a politician (Bruce Weitz) hiding a severe condition; Corday is caught off guard by a hot-shot new surgeon (Bruno Campos); and Romano risks his standing at County by overseeing an operation he's incapable of completing.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: A downed plane over the Great Lakes sends Abby's world into a tailspin; Romano's surgical career is altered forever; a teen is suspected of intentionally running down her classmates; and a terminal patient helps Lewis weigh the pros and cons of a blind date. Meanwhile, Pratt has an unexpected reaction to Chen's revelation about her baby. Alderman Bright: Bruce Weitz. Romano: Paul McCrane.

programme.title: ER
programme.sub-title: A Boy Falling Out of the Sky
programme.desc: Carter comes to the rescue when the stalled search for Abby's brother---and the arrival of her mother (Sally Field)---pushes the nurse to her limit. Meanwhile, Kovac comes back to work just in time to save an overdose case from frying his own brain; and Pratt digs himself into a deeper hole with Chen (Ming-Na) during his stint with the EMTs. Pratt: Mekhi Phifer. Lopez: Lisa Vidal. Lewis: Sherry Stringfield.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Three persons are murdered during a holdup at Doc Magoo's, and Chen's partial description of one of the perps leads to an unpleasant morning for Pratt and Gallant (Mekhi Phifer, Sharif Atkins); Lewis befriends a teenage cancer patient (Patrick Fugit), despite his mother's disapproval; and Carter decides to propose to Abby, who's having difficulty finding someone to give her mother (Sally Field) a ride to the bus station for her trip back to Wisconsin. Lewis: Sherry Stringfield.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: A favor for a popular but closeted politician (Bruce Weitz) has dire results for Kerry---and a patient; Carter and Abby come to terms with their ailing romance; Kovac finds an unusual outlet for his inner demons; and Romano's days as Chief of Staff begin to wane. Kerry: Laura Innes. Abby: Maura Tierney. Lewis: Sherry Stringfield. Chen: Ming-Na.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Heads roll and hearts break after Romano is demoted to the ER, where a mom-to-be hears grim news about her own health; Pratt's faux pas spoils Chen's birthday; and Luka implores Kerry and Corday to help him arrange a pro-bono operation for a dying Croatian child. Meanwhile, a patient's broken wrist leads to tragic complications---and a change of perspective for a County newlywed. Lewis: Sherry Stringfield. Pratt: Mekhi Phifer.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Weaver treats a lethargic 6-week-old baby; Lewis works with a mentally ill man who took too much of his anti-psychotic medication; and a Croatian physician observes surgery on a young boy with a congenital heart problem.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: As the fifth season opens, Wilson returns from an extended leave following Amber's death and announces he's leaving Princeton-Plainsboro. House thinks it's a terrible idea, and he isn't shy about saying so. Wilson's announcement also distracts him from the case at hand, that of the workaholic 37-year-old assistant to the leader of a major feminist organization who collapses during a business meeting. Thirteen takes a special interest in the case, and House questions her reasons for doing so.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: When people who received organs from a donor who was killed in an industrial accident five years earlier die suddenly, House must figure out why to save a recipient who's still alive. To track down information about the donor and the dead recipients, House hires a PI named Lucas (Michael Weston). But House also uses Lucas to snoop on Wilson as well as a colleague House is considering to replace Wilson as his friend.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A struggling artist (Breckin Meyer) taking part in three drug trials to pay his bills is also suffering from something that's altering his perception and threatening not only his livelihood but his life as well. Meanwhile, House has Lucas (Michael Weston) look into the private lives of his team, including Taub, whose marriage is in trouble.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House learns that his father (R. Lee Ermey) has died but must be coaxed into attending the funeral. Back at the hospital, the team struggles to treat a young Chinese-American adoptee who collapsed in China while searching for her birth parents, and House has to diagnose her over the phone. Meanwhile, flashbacks recall House's first meeting with Wilson. Blythe House: Diane Baker.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A woman with whom Thirteen had a one-night stand has a seizure at Thirteen's apartment, prompting intense curiosity (both professional and otherwise) about the women's personal lives from House and Foreman. Adding to the intrigue: Thirteen discovers why the woman wanted to sleep with her. Meanwhile, Lucas (Michael Weston) continues to snoop on Wilson.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A middle-aged single father who tests consumer products for a living and has been suffering unexplained blackouts turns out to be a sleepwalker. And soon his daughter falls ill as well. Meanwhile, Cuddy plans to adopt a child, but her birth mother falls gravely ill two weeks before her due date.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House and the team make a house call when an agoraphobe won't leave his home, but the patient's deteriorating condition makes it imperative to get him to a hospital. Meanwhile, House copes with a troublesome itch, and Cameron and Chase continue to refine their relationship.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The Season 5 premiere: Pride fights for his life in the ICU, and the team scours the city for the hit woman who attempted to assassinate him.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team searches for a former IRA bomb-maker who was smuggled into the city, and are joined by Special Agent Hannah Khoury, Pride's replacement during his medical leave. Also, Pride considers a new position with the agency.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the murder of a Navy intelligence officer killed during a conference for foreign diplomats, and the key witness cozies up to Sebastian. Also, Pride has some trouble adjusting to his new position at the agency.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A petty officer is found murdered under a shrimping boat, and the NCIS investigation uncovers a conspiracy in the tight-knit local fishing community. Also, Lasalle awaits the final results of the tax fraud investigation into his family's company.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride's father, Cassius Pride, is wrapped up in an NCIS case involving a notorious unsolved casino heist from several years ago. Also, Pride meets a family member he never knew existed. The episode marks the series' 100th installment; and also features Nathaniel Rateliff & the Night Sweats performing \"Hey Mama\" and \"You Worry Me.\".

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team uncovers evidence of a suspect who is harvesting organs from multiple victims after Pride's assistant, Ginny Young, escapes from a kidnapper. Also, Pride turns to his friend, Commander Calvin Atkins, M.D., for medical and spiritual guidance as he struggles with the ramifications of his recent brush with death.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Following a deadly car explosion in the French Quarter, the NCIS team interrogates a professor and former member of a student protest organization. Also, Tammy discovers a secret about Hannah's personal life.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team places Mateo Diaz, a high-school gang member-turned-informant, in protective custody while they investigate the murder of his junior reserve officers' training corps instructor. Also, Pride needs his brother Jimmy Boyd's help to gain Mateo's trust.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of a Navy contractor who, unbeknownst to anyone, lived two lives for decades, with two wives, families and careers.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray and Pops persuade Barry to lie to Beverly about joining the wrestling team. Meanwhile, Adam is disappointed when Erica cancels their plans to see the premiere of \"Return of the Jedi.\".

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray learns that his high-school free-throw record has been broken, and he's invited to attend a banquet as the guest of honor as the first season ends. Meanwhile, Barry throws a party but quickly finds himself out of the spotlight.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Abby gets a Dear John letter from Carter that makes the rounds faster than the hyper new resident (Glenn Howerton) whom Neela nearly kills with too much asthma medication. Meanwhile, the nursing crisis reaches a fever pitch; Corday and Dorset dispense with the formalities; and a young heart patient (Stephanie Lineburg) is kept in the dark about her grim prognosis. Morris: Scott Grimes. Dorset: Bruno Campos.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Pratt and Weaver wind up on the wrong side of two judgment calls during a hellacious night shift that also finds Abby seeking funds for a hush-hush personal endeavor. Meanwhile, second-year resident Coop (Glenn Howerton) proves his worth after a patient develops a mysterious neurological condition; Corday has a hard time getting used to her newly rejuvenated sex life; and Neela takes care of a young girl who shows up with her unconscious grandmother. Dorset: Bruno Campos. Morris: Scott Grimes.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Bob Newhart begins a three-episode role as an ailing architect whose gradual loss of vision touches a nerve in Lewis. Meanwhile, the rest of County is thrown off by a staggering backlog of patients; an alcoholic mother's grisly reaction to losing custody of her children; the arrival of a new nurse (Linda Cardellini); and Abby's career switch. Coop: Glenn Howerton.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Susan goes above and beyond the call of duty to help Ben Hollander (Bob Newhart) cope with his failing vision; Pratt's actions backfire for a mother in drastically premature labor; Abby uses her surgical rotation to teach a widow about organ donation; and Kovac battles a social worker over an overmedicated teen. Coop: Glenn Howerton. Neela: Parminder Nagra. Sam: Linda Cardellini.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Lewis's busy workload threatens to keep her from an important date with Hollander (Bob Newhart); Kovac and Corday clash over the treatment of a patient with questionable symptoms; and Sam's son spends a day underfoot at the ER. Meanwhile, Chen gets bad news from China about her parents. Alex: Oliver Davis. Coop: Glenn Howerton. Morris: Scott Grimes. Chuck: Donal Logue.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: A Thanksgiving tragedy high above the ER has the County staff racing to aid the survivors and Susan fearing the worst about one of the possible casualties. Meanwhile, Abby finally finds a reason to get over Carter, who may be heading back to Chicago sooner than anyone expected. Sam: Linda Cardellini. Chuck: Donal Logue.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Pratt takes a shine to Gallant's visiting sister (Joy Bryant); Neela reaches out to a pair of car-crash victims struggling with returning to their strict Amish families; and Susan races to locate the missing parents of a 5-year-old Jane Doe. Meanwhile, Sam bristles at Luka's attention to her young son. Alex: Oliver Davis. Sam: Linda Cardellini.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: During an examination of a teen's heart problems, the team begins to doubt her claims of being an emancipated minor. Meanwhile, Foreman defies House's rejection of a proposal to conduct a clinical trial.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A fitness guru known for her \"natural\" lifestyle collapses while shooting an infomercial. Meanwhile, Thirteen participates in a clinical drug trial for Huntington's disease led by Foreman; Kutner operates an online medical-advice clinic under House's name; and Cuddy moves into House's office while hers is being repaired, much to House's dismay.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A troubled teen collapses during her high-school Christmas program; Foreman and Thirteen learn more about each other as they work together on the Huntington's disease drug trial; House gives and receives holiday gifts, leading to team speculation; and Cuddy receives a gift as well. Janice: Lori Petty.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: At Cameron's urging, the team takes the case of a suicidal man who suffers from excruciating chronic pain---pain that mirrors House's. Meanwhile, Cuddy discovers that caring for her newly adopted baby leaves her little time to run the hospital; and Foreman and Thirteen continue to explore their complicated relationship as they work together on their Huntington's disease drug trial.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: When Cuddy decides to spend more time caring for her baby, she hands some of her day-to-day responsibilities to Cameron. One of them is supervising House, whose patient is a very nice special-education teacher who collapsed in class. House doesn't think that her niceness is a good thing. Meanwhile, Foreman must make a critical decision regarding Thirteen's participation in the Huntington's drug trial.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A woman who collapses during a cooking class turns out to be a renowned cancer researcher who gave up her career to pursue personal fulfillment. This prompts the docs to grapple with their own pursuits of happiness. Meanwhile, Cuddy decides to make House's life more miserable than it usually is, and Thirteen's health takes a turn for the worse.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A priest who runs a homeless shelter is admitted to the ER after seeing a bleeding Jesus hovering at his doorstep. House takes the case to distract the team while he confronts Foreman and Thirteen about their relationship, but it causes House to grapple with his past and his beliefs.

programme.title: She's All That

Matthew Lillard, Paul Walker, Jodi Lyn O'Keefe, Kevin Pollak, Kieran Culkin, Elden Ratliff, Anna Paquin.

Paul Winfield and Cicely Tyson were Oscar-nominated as the parents, and the film received a nod for Best Adapted Screenplay.

The film launched Bill Haley & the Comets' rock-and-roll anthem \"Rock Around the Clock.\".

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Oscar-nominated adaptation of Jane Austen's novel about the still-single Dashwood sisters and how they cope with men, marriage and money after their father dies. The screenplay (written by star Emma Thompson) was the sole Oscar winner out of seven nominations.

programme.title: Persuasion
programme.desc: A faithful adaptation of Jane Austen's bittersweet novel about a lonely woman (Amanda Root) who may get a second chance at love when she reconnects with a poor but dashing British sailor whom she once rejected, but who's now come back into her life as a well-to-do captain.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Adaptation of Jane Austen's classic 1813 novel about romance and mores in pre-Victorian English society revolves around five middle-class sisters being courted by a variety of suitors. Of special note is the fractious relationship between spirited Elizabeth Bennet and haughty aristocrat Fitzwilliam Darcy.

programme.title: Magic

programme.title: Dolls

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: An undercover police officer who was investigating ATM robberies is murdered and found with a bag of diamonds inside his mutilated body. Meanwhile, Brennan's stiff personality is no asset when she's the subject of a documentary commissioned to raise money for the Jeffersonian.

programme.title: Bones

programme.desc: The guys go behind-the-scenes to find out what gag caused the normally quiet crew to crack up and which guy required medical attention during the fat-foot-race punishment.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse (Ben Stiller) visits his girlfriend's family with the intent of asking her dad (Robert De Niro) for her hand in marriage. Not so easy. Her father turns out to be a very protective, very intimidating, very suspicious ex-CIA agent. Blythe Danner, Teri Polo, Owen Wilson.

programme.title: Big Trick Energy
programme.desc: Chris, Wes and Alex convince Eric to get a dog for his girlfriend. Plus, Chris reads people's minds and Eric rolls trick shots in a bowling alley.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers: Inside Jokes
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes footage reveals why grocery-store challenges take place in the dairy aisle and the secret ingredient in Grandma Oil.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers: Inside Jokes
programme.desc: The guys go behind-the-scenes to reveal what supermarket challenge became a favorite game and what two Murr punishments took place in the exact same room.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers: Inside Jokes
programme.desc: The guys go behind-the-scenes to reveal what Times Square restaurant shut down just a few months after the guys posed there as hosts and how Sal's Homeland Security punishment surprise was nearly blown at the last minute.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Exciting car chases and frenetic martial-arts action fortify this action-packed crime thriller from writer-producer Luc Besson. Jason Statham stars as Frank Martin, a deliveryman of illicit packages who gets mixed up in an Asian slave ring. Shu Qi, Matt Schulze, Ric Young, Francois Berleand.

programme.title: Skyline
programme.desc: A series of bright lights appear all over L.A., mesmerizing the populace and luring them to an uncertain fate in this highly inventive sci-fi thriller. Meanwhile, an entrepreneur (Donald Faison) and his friends seek out the source of this alien threat.

programme.title: Blinded by the Light
programme.desc: A second-generation British-Pakistani teenager comes of age in a small town during the Thatcher era, rebelling against parental and cultural expectations and the confines of provincial life with the help of Bruce Springsteen's empowering music and relatable lyricism.

programme.title: Tully
programme.desc: At the encouragement of her brother, Marlo, an overwhelmed mother of three, and her husband Drew hire a young night nurse named Tully to care for their newborn. Tully becomes a confidant for Marlo, who is grappling with her identity as a wife and mother.

programme.title: Snow White and the Huntsman
programme.desc: In this rousing take on the classic tale, an evil queen orders the death of Snow White, who is being trained in the art of war by a huntsman. Meanwhile, a prince becomes enthralled by Snow White's beauty and strength.

programme.title: Cruel Intentions
programme.desc: The seductive Kathryn (Sarah Michelle Gellar) poses the ultimate challenge to her charming stepbrother, Sebastian (Ryan Phillippe). If he can deflower the headmaster's virgin daughter (Reese Witherspoon), then Sebastian can have Kathryn for one night. If he fails, she gets his vintage car.

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Desperate to get their music heard on the radio, members of a heavy-metal band hold a radio station hostage.

programme.title: The Campaign
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, two powerful CEOs attempt to turn a tourism-center director into a viable political candidate in order to defeat the blundering congressman of a crucial North Carolina district.

programme.title: Becoming Jane
programme.desc: A romance between the young, love-struck author Jane Austen and a penniless Irish lawyer serves as the creative inspiration for her work in this enchanting, speculative story starring Anne Hathaway (\"The Devil Wears Prada\"). James McAvoy, Julie Walters, James Cromwell, Maggie Smith, Joe Anderson. Directed by Julian Jarrold.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon give award-winning performances and do their own singing in this touching portrait of music legend Johnny Cash and his tumultuous love affair with June Carter. Ginnifer Goodwin, Robert Patrick, Dallas Roberts. Directed by James Mangold.

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: Hard-hitting drama about a white rapper from inner-city Detroit whose talent for wordplay inspires dreams of a career in hip-hop. The original song \"Lose Yourself\" won an Oscar.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask (?)
programme.desc: In 17th-century France, the four musketeers devise a plan to replace the widely hated King Louis XIV with a twin brother who has been imprisoned for the past six years with an iron mask on his face.

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: In this high-octane sequel packed with exciting car chases and martial-arts battles, an ex-Special Forces operative (Jason Statham) is working as a chauffeur for a wealthy family and springs into action when his employers' young son is kidnapped. Alessandro Gassman, Amber Valletta, Kate Nauta, Matthew Modine. Directed by Louis Leterrier.

programme.title: Basic Instinct
programme.desc: While on suspension, police detective Nick Curran becomes romantically involved with a writer who may be a murderer.

programme.title: Phantom
programme.desc: In this gripping, nail-biting drama, a haunted Soviet officer must prevent his submarine from launching a nuclear attack on the United States.

programme.title: Doubt
programme.desc: Writer-director John Patrick Shanley adapts his Pulitzer Prize-winning play into an incendiary battle of wills involving a demagogic nun (Meryl Streep) who's convinced that the parish priest (Philip Seymour Hoffman) is engaged in sexual misconduct with a 12-year-old male student (Joseph Foster II) in their Bronx grade school. A top-notch ensemble cast is excellently aided by Amy Adams as a young nun and Viola Davis as the young boy's mother.

programme.title: Beginners
programme.desc: In this uplifting comedy-drama, Oliver (Ewan McGregor) deals with his 75-year-old father Hal's announcement that he's gay and has been diagnosed with terminal cancer. He learns about life and love from Hal before his dad passes away, and soon falls for a French actress.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon give award-winning performances and do their own singing in this touching portrait of music legend Johnny Cash and his tumultuous love affair with June Carter. Ginnifer Goodwin, Robert Patrick, Dallas Roberts. Directed by James Mangold.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
programme.desc: Powerful and sensitive adaptation of John Boyne's novel about the horrors of the Holocaust, as seen through the naïve eyes of the 8-year-old son of a Nazi commandant who befriends a Jewish boy in a concentration camp.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: In the Coen brothers' stirring remake of the John Wayne classic, an alcoholic U.S. Marshal and an independent-minded 14-year-old girl track down her father's killer with the help of a Texas Ranger. As the three brave dangerous Indian territory, they discover their prey has fallen in with a more-experienced criminal.

programme.title: Company Business
programme.desc: A former CIA agent is tasked with accompanying a captured KGB mole to Berlin for a spy swap. The two uncover an international conspiracy and are chased around Europe by both their agencies.

programme.title: Showdown in Little Tokyo
programme.desc: Two culturally different detectives team up to take down a drug kingpin, who murdered one partner's parents.

programme.title: The Shooting
programme.desc: An ex-bounty hunter and his partner are hired to escort a strange woman across the desert and are soon joined by a volatile gunslinger. Before long, the ex-bounty hunter discovers he's been hoodwinked into taking part in a revenge plot.

programme.title: Before Sunset
programme.desc: Director Richard Linklater (\"School of Rock\") reunites with Julie Delpy and Ethan Hawke for this charming follow-up to \"Before Sunrise.\" The story picks up nine years after their one night of romance, as the former lovers cross paths again in Paris. He's in France on a publicity tour for his book about their chance encounter.

programme.title: A Very Brady Sequel
programme.desc: The '70s-trapped Bradys must travel to Hawaii to save the family after Carol's first husband shows up and threatens their idyllic existence. As Carol is torn between two husbands, Mike struggles to hold the family together and Alice cooks a lot of meat loaf. Shelley Long, Gary Cole, Tim Matheson, Christopher Daniel Barnes, Christine Taylor, Paul Sutera, Jennifer Elise Cox, Henriette Mantel.

programme.title: Cats
programme.desc: A tribe of unruly and anthropomorphic city cats, the Jellicles, approach their yearly ceremony. The tribe must elect one of their ranks to venture to the Heaviside Layer and reincarnate as a new life in the Jellicle tribe. Based on the poetry collection by T.S. Eliot.

programme.title: City of Ghosts
programme.desc: Matt Dillon does triple duty---he directed, co-wrote the script and stars---in this atmospheric and suspenseful crime drama. He plays con man Jimmy Cremming, who goes to Cambodia to meet with his mentor.

programme.title: The Rite
programme.desc: Veteran priest Father Lucas (Anthony Hopkins) teaches incredulous seminary student Michael Kovak about performing exorcisms, and together they discover that even the Vatican isn't free from the Devil's influence in this terrifying supernatural thriller. Inspired by a true story.

programme.title: Shrink
programme.desc: Jaded psychiatrist Henry Carter (Kevin Spacey) takes on a pro bono case that tests his professional fortitude in this blistering exposé of the \"other\" Hollywood. Between sorting through the various mental maladies of his famous patients, Henry barely has any time to deal with his own problems. Into the middle of the hapless shrink's malaise wanders a troubled teen who's his polar opposite. While Henry is tired of Tinseltown, his newest patient is obsessed with it.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: When their mobster husbands are sent to prison by the FBI, three New York housewives decide to continue their husbands' business on their own, soon becoming the most powerful mobsters in 1970s Hell's Kitchen.

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: During Christmas break, a group of female students realizes someone is watching their every move. While pledging for a sorority, they realize that their stalker is a murderer operating out of a secret society in their college's shady underbelly. The girls then decide to take matters into their own hands in order to rid themselves of this presence once and for all.

programme.title: Mama
programme.desc: A loving couple learn that their two adopted nieces have brought a dark secret into their home when the little girls begin to whisper of the malevolent Mama who watches over their every move in this frightening tale of domestic terror. Now they must determine if Mama is the ghost of their dead mother, or if the two young girls are simply dealing with the emotional aftershocks of a life-altering tragedy.

programme.title: Down a Dark Hall
programme.desc: A short-tempered young girl is sent to a mysterious boarding school run by an intense headmistress. The girl, Kit, meets and befriends her only other schoolmates, also four troubled girls, and as they explore their new surroundings they discover the school harbors a dark secret.

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: Riveting thriller about a family man whose son needs a lifesaving heart-transplant operation. When his health-care plan doesn't cover the boy's medical procedure, he takes drastic steps to rectify the situation.

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An ambitious stock broker becomes the protégé of a ruthless corporate shark. Eventually the billionaire takes a financial interest in the airline company where the protégé's father has been employed for decades.

programme.title: The Way Back
programme.desc: An alcoholic who has endured family tragedy works to redeem himself by coaching his high school alma mater's basketball team. But as he's brought back to his glory days as a promising athlete, he's forced to confront the demons that derailed him earlier in life.

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institute's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: An innocent teen vacationing with her upper-middle-class parents at an upscale resort in the 1960s Catskills gets a jolt of culture shock when she crushes on the hotel's slick, handsome dance instructor. The soundtrack yielded the Oscar-winning Best Song \"(I've Had the) Time of My Life.\".

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: In this stunning period drama set in 1950s London, a meticulous tailor for the rich and famous suddenly finds himself in love with a working-class woman. Their worlds collide as the tailor's obsession with her begins to disturb his professional life.

programme.title: The Namesake
programme.desc: A Bengali family tries to acclimate to life in the U.S. in this poignant and bittersweet saga of cultures clashing across generations. Their teenage son (Kal Penn) does not embrace their Indian heritage until he visits Calcutta, where he gains an understanding of the importance of his family's past. Indian-born Mira Nair directed from a script by Sooni Taraporevala, who adapted Pulitzer Prize-winner Jhumpa Lahiri's novel. Bollywood superstar Tabu costars as Penn's old-world mother.

programme.title: Skyline
programme.desc: A series of bright lights appear all over L.A., mesmerizing the populace and luring them to an uncertain fate in this highly inventive sci-fi thriller. Meanwhile, an entrepreneur (Donald Faison) and his friends seek out the source of this alien threat.

programme.title: Throw Momma from the Train
programme.desc: An inept student offers to kill the ex-wife of his professor in exchange for the teacher murdering the student's mother.

programme.title: Cop Land
programme.desc: An honest, small-town New Jersey sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) is torn between loyalty to his fellow officers and his responsibility to uphold the law after a member of Internal Affairs asks him to help bring down a group of corrupt cops. Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta, Peter Berg, Janeane Garofalo, Robert Patrick, Michael Rapaport, Annabella Sciorra, Noah Emmerich, Cathy Moriarty.

programme.title: The Big Hit
programme.desc: Four expert hit men blast their way into a slave trader's stronghold, gaining the favor of a powerful mob boss. But when they kidnap a young heiress who happens to be the boss's goddaughter, they soon become targets themselves. A hard-hitting action-thriller executive produced by John Woo. Mark Wahlberg, Lou Diamond Phillips, Christina Applegate, Antonio Sabato Jr., Lela Rochon.

programme.title: Rob Roy
programme.desc: Epic tale of the18th-century Scottish outlaw Robert Roy MacGregor, whose battles to protect his family from corrupt moneylenders made him a hero.

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: An ex-CIA operative leads a quest into the dangerous African Congo in search of her presumed dead fiancé. Along for the ride is a primatologist, his assistant, a talking gorilla, a Romanian backer with his own agenda and a jungle-savvy mercenary. Based on the novel by Michael Crichton.

programme.title: Ganja & Hess (?)
programme.desc: Melodrama about a black anthropologist who contracts a rare disease, requiring blood. Duane Jones, Marlene Clark, Leonard Jackson. Queen of Myrthia: Mabel King. Girl in Bar: Candece Tarpley. Dinner Guest: Richard Harrow.

programme.title: Smokin' Aces 2: Assassins' Ball (?)
programme.desc: The world's top assassins go gunning for an FBI desk jockey in this prequel. When word gets out that G-man Walter Weed (Tom Berenger) has a price of $3 million on his head, every killer in the world begins loading up on ammo in hopes of making the hit. But Agent Baker (Clayne Crawford) and his team are determined to keep Weed alive, even if it means taking up arms against the psychotic Tremor family, whose notorious reputation for carnage precedes them.

programme.title: I'm Gonna Git You Sucka
programme.desc: Keenen Ivory Wayans wrote, directed and stars in this parody of \"blaxploitation\" films, about a man avenging his brother's death.

programme.title: Throw Momma from the Train
programme.desc: An inept student offers to kill the ex-wife of his professor in exchange for the teacher murdering the student's mother.

programme.title: Leadbelly
programme.desc: About the life and career of legendary guitarist-folk singer Huddie Ledbetter (1888-1949).

programme.title: Blackout
programme.desc: Two strangers are about to witness the death of the Sun. This short film takes place in the approximate eight minutes it takes for light to reach Earth from the Sun, as two strangers, Sampson and Darryl, discuss what they wish they could have done differently had they not taken sunlight for granted.

programme.title: Why Stop Now
programme.desc: A piano prodigy prepares for an interview at Juilliard, while his mother attempts to buy cocaine in order to force her insurance to pay for her rehab in this endearingly quirky comedy.

programme.title: Apres Vous
programme.desc: Romance and farcical comedy blend in this entertaining French film. After a Paris restaurant maitre d' (Daniel Auteuil) saves a stranger from hanging himself, he takes him under his wing---but then falls for the same woman the suicidal man loves. Pierre Salvadori directed and co-wrote the film, which is also known as \"After You.\" Jose Garcia, Sandrine Kiberlain, Marilyne Canto.

programme.title: Le fabuleux destin d'Amélie Poulain (?)
programme.desc: À 22 ans, la vie d'Amélie Poulain est simple, elle aime casser la croûte des crèmes brûlées, faire des ricochets au bord de la Seine et observer les gens. Mais depuis peu, Amélie a trouvé un sens à sa vie... changer celle des autres. Audrey Tautou, Mathieu Kassovitz, Rufus, Yolande Moreau, Jamel Debbouze.

programme.title: Winter Solstice
programme.desc: Anthony LaPaglia is superb as a grieving widower who struggles to deal with his youngest son's self-destructive behavior and his oldest son's decision to leave home. Josh Sternfeld wrote and directed this poignant family drama. Aaron Stanford, Mark Webber, Allison Janney.

programme.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre
programme.desc: A group of friends travel through rural Texas and encounter a family of cannibals who have sick fun desecrating human remains.

programme.title: Hamburger Hill
programme.desc: Vietnam diary of a U.S. platoon's assault on an NVA stronghold. Dylan McDermott. Doc: Courtney Vance. Languilli: Anthony Barrile. Motown: Michael Patrick Boatman. Washburn: Don Cheadle. Directed by John Irvin.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: Clive Cussler's thrilling bestseller comes to life in this action-packed adventure. Matthew McConaughey stars as an intrepid explorer who helps a doctor (Penelope Cruz) contain a plague in Africa while searching for buried treasure. Breck Eisner directed. Steve Zahn, Lambert Wilson, Glynn Turman, Delroy Lindo, William H. Macy.

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: After losing his friend, an impetuous Navy pilot is accepted into Miramar's elite Fighter School. There, the pilot engages in a romance with his instructor while competing against a rival student flier for the program's coveted award.

programme.title: Save the Date
programme.desc: In this offbeat comedy-drama, a commitment-phobic woman dumps her clingy boyfriend after he attempts to propose to her, and she soon moves on to a rebound relationship. Meanwhile, her wedding-obsessed sister disapproves of her impulsive new romance.

programme.title: The Watermelon Woman
programme.desc: A filmmaker profiles an unknown black actress from the 1930s in this comedy.

programme.title: Seven Psychopaths
programme.desc: In this outrageous, oddball comedy from the writer-director of \"In Bruges,\" a screenwriter and his friends must contend with Los Angeles' most-insane criminals after they kidnap a gangster's precious shih tzu.

programme.title: You Better Watch Out
programme.desc: Seasonal horror about a psychotic toy-maker who keeps a list of bad boys and girls.

programme.title: Hannah and Her Sisters
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote, directed and stars in this relationship comedy about three Manhattan sisters and the men in their lives. One of the women suspects her husband of lusting after her youngest sister. Oscars went to Allen for his screenplay and to supporting actors Dianne Wiest and Michael Caine.

programme.title: Dick
programme.desc: Michelle Williams and Kirsten Dunst are a blast in this sly satire as ditzy 1970s high schoolers hired as dog-walkers by President Nixon (Dan Hedaya). When Watergate erupts, the girls' behind-the-scenes access leads them to uncover surprising secrets. Teri Garr, Dave Foley, Jim Breuer, Will Ferrell.

programme.title: Your Sister's Sister
programme.desc: In this quirky, poignant comedy-drama, Jack is grieving the death of his brother Tom when he is invited by Tom's former girlfriend Iris to spend some time at her family's cottage, where he has a drunken one-night stand with Iris' lesbian sister Hannah.

programme.title: Death Wish
programme.desc: A liberal Manhattan architect turns into a vigilante after his wife is killed and his daughter raped and the police are unable to apprehend the men responsible.

programme.title: Rollerball
programme.desc: Norman Jewison directed this tale about a world where war has been replaced by a violent sport.

programme.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance
programme.desc: Robert Redford directed this magical fable about a golfer (Matt Damon) who returns from WWI with post-traumatic stress disorder. He does get a chance to turn his life around, however, when he receives a visit from a mysterious caddy (Will Smith). Charlize Theron, Bruce McGill, Joel Gretsch, J. Michael Moncrief, Lane Smith.

programme.title: Far From Heaven
programme.desc: Best Actress nominee Julianne Moore stars in writer-director Todd Haynes' sumptuous homage to the melodramas of the 1950s. Moore is superb as an affluent wife and mother whose picture-perfect world is shattered by a shocking discovery about her husband (Dennis Quaid) and a forbidden love affair. Dennis Haysbert, Patricia Clarkson, James Rebhorn, Viola Davis.

programme.title: Hannah and Her Sisters
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote, directed and stars in this relationship comedy about three Manhattan sisters and the men in their lives. One of the women suspects her husband of lusting after her youngest sister. Oscars went to Allen for his screenplay and to supporting actors Dianne Wiest and Michael Caine.

programme.title: The Night We Never Met
programme.desc: Romantic complications ensue when three yuppies decide to time-share a New York City apartment.

programme.title: Halloween H20: 20 Years Later (?)
programme.desc: Jamie Lee Curtis returns in this chilling 20th-anniversary sequel as madman Michael Myers' long-lost sister. Laurie Strode (Curtis) runs a prep school and lives a peaceful life---until her maniac brother returns to crash her son's Halloween party. But Laurie vows not to allow their bloody family history to repeat itself.

programme.title: Hoodlum
programme.desc: This stylish crime saga features an intense star turn by Laurence Fishburne as real-life 1930s gangster Ellsworth \"Bumpy\" Johnson. The plot centers on Bumpy's attempt to keep mobster Dutch Schultz from muscling in on the lucrative Harlem numbers racket. Tim Roth, Vanessa L. Williams, Andy Garcia, Cicely Tyson, Chi McBride, Clarence Williams III, Richard Bradford, William Atherton, Loretta Devine, Queen Latifah.

programme.title: Rollerball
programme.desc: Norman Jewison directed this tale about a world where war has been replaced by a violent sport.

programme.title: Good Boy!
programme.desc: From Jim Henson Pictures comes this delightful fantasy for the whole family. Matthew Broderick lends his voice to Canid 3942, an alien dog sent to Earth to investigate why dogs haven't fulfilled their real mission---to take over the world.

programme.title: Breakin' 2 Electric Boogaloo
programme.desc: Teens teaching breakdancing at a community center battle to raise money to save the facility from greedy developers and a crooked politician.

programme.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde
programme.desc: Reese Witherspoon shines as perpetually perky lawyer Elle Woods in this delightful sequel. When Elle discovers that her dog's mother is a victim of laboratory testing, she tries to persuade a congresswoman to back an animal-rights bill.

programme.title: Rosemary's Baby
programme.desc: A young woman living in an old New York City apartment building becomes pregnant following a horrible nightmare, and begins to fear the worst for her unborn child while suspecting that she is surrounded by evil.

programme.title: 'Crocodile' Dundee
programme.desc: A rugged Australian crocodile hunter visits New York at the best of a female journalist who wants to write a profile of him. He discovers that his natural skills and talents come in just as handy in the big city as they do in the Outback.

programme.title: Mr. Baseball
programme.desc: A burned-out American slugger is traded to a team in Japan, where he's reluctant to embrace his new surroundings.

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: A rich young woman marries a poor radio announcer and finds their relationship tested on a disaster-filled European honeymoon. The couple's chemistry and the characters' outrageous antics make the film.

programme.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
programme.desc: Aided by a young journalist, a woman searches for clues about her mother, who died of cancer in 1951 but not before samples of healthy and cancerous tissues were secretly harvested from her and subsequently used for medical research for decades to come. Based on Rebecca Skloot's best-selling book that took 10 years to research and write.

programme.title: In Treatment
programme.desc: Brooke agrees to refer Eladio to a psychiatrist before his medication runs out, but only if he truly commits to therapy first. When pressed about his employers, Eladio opens up about his complicated relationship with their family.

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Action maestro Ridley Scott (\"Alien\"; \"Gladiator\") shifts gears for this witty and intelligent caper about a con artist (Nicolas Cage) whose peculiar psychological problems are compounded when he meets the daughter (Alison Lohman) he never knew he had. Sam Rockwell, Bruce Altman, Bruce McGill, Sheila Kelly, Jenny O'Hara, Steve Eastin.

programme.title: Oslo
programme.desc: A small group of Palestinians, Israelis, and a Norwegian couple lead a peace agreement between Palestine and Israel.

programme.title: The New Mutants
programme.desc: When Illyana, Rahne, Sam, Danielle, and Roberto — five teenage mutants who are just discovering their superhuman abilities — are held inside an isolated hospital to be psychologically monitored, strange occurrences begin to happen. As events intensify, they find themselves embarking on a mission to escape the facility and save their lives, putting their newfound friendship and powers to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: Extract
programme.desc: Personal disaster yields big laughs when factory owner Joel (Jason Bateman) finds his marriage and career on the rocks after an employee has an accident and threatens to sue. Ben Affleck, Mila Kunis, Kristen Wiig. Written and directed by Mike Judge.

programme.title: Primal Fear
programme.desc: Richard Gere and Oscar nominee Edward Norton star in this intense courtroom drama. Gere plays slick lawyer Martin Vail, who agrees to defend a guileless 19-year-old (Norton) who has been accused in the brutal murder of the Archbishop of Chicago. Though Vail sees the case as a way to gain publicity, the revelations in the case begin to chill him.

programme.title: Liberty: Mother of Exiles
programme.desc: This documentary follows fashion designer Diane von Furstenberg as she explores the iconic Statue of Liberty's historical and contemporary significance. She discovers French sculptor Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi's inspiration for its design and the powerful democratic symbolism it holds for immigrants and freedom fighters across the globe.

programme.title: Ella Enchanted
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway (\"The Princess Diaries\") stars in this whimsical fairy tale. She plays a young woman trying to lift a curse that makes her unflaggingly obedient. During her travels, she befriends an elf, gets embroiled in palace intrigue and falls in love with a dashing prince (Hugh Dancy).

programme.title: The Return
programme.desc: This film examines the many challenges of reintegration faced by convicts and their families after a new law mandates the prisoners' early release.

programme.title: The Loving Story
programme.desc: This poignant documentary profiles Richard and Mildred Loving, a married, interracial couple who challenged anti-miscegenation laws in Virginia after being arrested in 1958, and fought a legal battle that resulted in a landmark 1967 case before the U.S. Supreme Court.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding historical thriller set during the early days of WWII, a number of civilian boats set out to rescue 400,000 British and Allied troops trapped on the beaches of Dunkirk, France, before they are decimated by Nazi forces.

programme.title: Drumline
programme.desc: Energetic drama about a hotshot New York City percussionist who adjusts to the demands of a big-time college marching band while trying to fit in at the prestigious Atlanta university.

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: In this heartwarming sports drama, Keanu Reeves plays a ne'er-do-well gambler who learns something about the game of life when he agrees to coach an inner-city Chicago Little League team. Talented kid actors pitch in to provide solid relief. Diane Lane, John Hawkes, DeWayne Warren, Michael Jordan, Michael Perkins, Julian Griffith, Bryan C. Hearne, A. Delon Ellis Jr., Brian M. Reed.

programme.title: Tenet
programme.desc: In the not-so-distant future, a special agent agrees to a risky new mission using the latest advancements in time travel and human evolution to change his present as rival nations vie for global supremacy, ushering in the threat of a third World War that could put an end to life on Earth.

programme.title: In Treatment
programme.desc: Brooke insists reuniting with Adam will not awaken destructive habits, but Rita recognizes her actions as part of a recurring pattern, and encourages her to spend more time embracing the present.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: An award-winning monthly sports journalism series with investigative pieces and in-depth profiles from across the sports spectrum.

programme.title: War Horse
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg directed this thrilling adventure following the friendship forged between a young man (Jeremy Irvine) and his horse. When World War I forces the two to part, the remarkable horse inspires everyone he meets, from German soldiers to British cavalry and a humble farming family.

programme.title: The Crime of the Century
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. A look at how Purdue Pharma worked with the FDA to get OxyContin approved for wider use, promoting the highly profitable pain medication's safety without sufficient evidence, and creating a campaign to redefine pain and how it's treated.

programme.title: In Treatment
programme.desc: Colin chronicles the events that took him from \"gold stars all around\" to getting serious demerits in prison. After connecting his troubling behavior to a feeling of profound powerlessness, Brooke challenges Colin to accept responsibility for his actions.

programme.title: Orange County
programme.desc: Hollywood's next generation takes center stage as Colin Hanks (son of Tom) stars in this comedy from director Jake Kasdan (son of Lawrence). It's the story of a California high-school senior (Hanks) who jumps through hoops to get into Stanford after a mishap with his transcript. Schuyler Fisk, Jack Black, Catherine O'Hara, John Lithgow, Lily Tomlin, Chevy Chase.

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: In this hip crime drama, a spoiled rich teen's (Henry Thomas) sister is abducted, and he and his punk friends decide to kidnap an ex-mob boss (Christopher Walken) as a negotiating tool. But the wily mobster turns the tables on his bungling captors. Denis Leary, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Laura San Giacomo.

programme.title: Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Riotous and outlandish spoof of disaster flicks following a group of attractive young people looking for a safe haven while dodging a deluge of natural and unnatural calamities. Carmen Electra, Matt Lanter. Among the films targeted: \"Iron Man,\" \"The Incredible Hulk,\" \"Hancock,\" \"Enchanted,\" \"Juno,\" \"Sex and the City\" and \"Cloverfield.\" The movie also lampoons pop figures such as Amy Winehouse and Hannah Montana. Produced, written and directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.

programme.title: The Pallbearer
programme.desc: A twentysomething slacker gets a wake-up call when an old friend from high school kills himself. After the funeral, he starts an affair with the deceased man's mother.

programme.title: Ford v Ferrari
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Ferrari is an untouchable figure in racing. With Enzo Ferrari ardently chasing after excellence, the company is irrefutably the best there is. Ford's Henry Ford II wants in on the success, and so he journeys to Italy to propose a merger with the automobile giant. His plan, however, is met with ridicule. With a hurt ego, he enlists the help of car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles to build a car that would defeat Ferrari at the 1966 24 Hours of Le Mans.

programme.title: Wendy
programme.desc: A soft-spoken Louisiana girl journeys to an exciting, ethereal and tropical island jungle called Neverland where children never grow old. However, her whimsical, carefree behavior is soon marred by the realization of what happens when mortality descends on the young.

programme.title: Oslo
programme.desc: A small group of Palestinians, Israelis, and a Norwegian couple lead a peace agreement between Palestine and Israel.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: Upon hearing the news that a huge comet will hit Earth within 48 hours and start the dreaded apocalypse, John Garrity, his estranged wife Allison, and their son Nathan decide to make their way to Greenland, where a group of bunkers is located. The journey, however, proves to be more perilous than they anticipated. Amidst the growing panic and lawlessness around them, the family tries their hardest to catch the last flight to the last possible safe haven on the planet.

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: An award-winning monthly sports journalism series with investigative pieces and in-depth profiles from across the sports spectrum.

programme.title: In Treatment
programme.desc: Brooke shares a traumatic experience from her own childhood in an effort to connect with Laila over feeling controlled by her family. As Brooke digs into her proclivity for unbridled imagination and storytelling as a coping mechanism, Laila reveals a surprising plan for her future.

programme.title: The Dark Knight Rises
