programme.desc: The third film in the thrilling comic-book series finds Bruce Wayne donning the Batman costume once again as the Dark Knight in order to battle Catwoman and Bane, a fierce foe possessed of tremendous physical and intellectual strength.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: Little Children
programme.desc: Best Actress nominee Kate Winslet gives a tour-de-force performance in this gripping and incisive slice of suburban life set in Massachusetts. She plays an unhappy housewife who enters into a ruinous affair with a restless stay-at-home dad (Patrick Wilson). Best Supporting Actor nominee Jackie Earle Haley costars as a paroled pedophile trying to jump-start his life. Directed by Todd Field, who co-wrote the script with Tom Perrotta, upon whose novel the Oscar-nominated screenplay is based.

programme.title: He Got Game
programme.desc: Spike Lee's moving story centers on a killer (Denzel Washington) who is granted a temporary leave from prison to persuade his son (NBA star Ray Allen, in his big-screen debut), a talented young basketball player, to attend the governor's alma mater. Milla Jovovich, Rosario Dawson, Hill Harper.

programme.title: The Photograph
programme.desc: The estranged daughter of a famed photographer initiates a romantic relationship with an up-and-coming journalist who is working on a story about her late mother's life and artistic legacy after discovering an old photograph in a safe-deposit box.

programme.title: Old Dogs
programme.desc: Get ready for big laughs when depressed divorcé Dan and laid-back bachelor Charlie are unexpectedly saddled with 7-year-old twins just as they're about to make a monumental business deal. As the twins lead the unlikely father figures on a series of comic misadventures, Dan and Charlie begin to reassess their priorities in life.

programme.title: Lincoln
programme.desc: In this literate, inspiring historical drama, Abraham Lincoln attempts to outlaw slavery by fighting for the passage of the 13th Amendment to the Constitution, all while negotiating peace with the South and dealing with his mentally unstable wife.

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Action maestro Ridley Scott (\"Alien\"; \"Gladiator\") shifts gears for this witty and intelligent caper about a con artist (Nicolas Cage) whose peculiar psychological problems are compounded when he meets the daughter (Alison Lohman) he never knew he had. Sam Rockwell, Bruce Altman, Bruce McGill, Sheila Kelly, Jenny O'Hara, Steve Eastin.

programme.title: Wrath of the Titans
programme.desc: In this riveting fantasy sequel, Perseus (Sam Worthington) ventures into the underworld in order to rescue Zeus (Liam Neeson) from the clutches of Hades (Ralph Fiennes), Ares and Kronos, who want to steal Zeus' power and subjugate humanity.

programme.title: Varsity Blues
programme.desc: In this rousing coming-of-age tale, a second-string high-school quarterback (James Van Der Beek) replaces the injured starter. At first, the quarterback revels in his new role, but then, his relaxed attitude causes problems with his gung-ho coach (Jon Voight). Paul Walker, Rob Lester, Scott Caan, Richard Lineback, Ali Larter, Tiffany C. Love.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Action and adventure erupt yet again when the evil mummy returns in this effects-laden sequel to the 1999 hit. In 1933, Rick and Evie's son Alex joins the gang to take on the resurrected Imhotep, who's battling the Scorpion King for world domination. Brendan Fraser, Arnold Vosloo, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Oded Fehr, Freddie Boath.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: After a heroic rescue lands her in the hospital, Mare awakes to the pain of losing a friend. Then, given a second chance by Chief Carter, Mare reevaluates old suspects, which leads to a shocking clue. Meanwhile, Richard visits Mare in hopes of deepening their relationship, and Lori confides in her best friend about recent family troubles.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: A Black Lady Sketch Show
programme.sub-title: Way to Ruin the Party, Soya!

programme.title: Pitch Perfect
programme.desc: The laughs never stop as a feisty college student gives her school's a cappella group a much-needed makeover by adding some modern hits into the mix during the run-up to a big competition.

programme.title: Dream House
programme.desc: In this white-knuckle thriller, Will discovers that his family have been targeted by a deranged killer who massacred the people who previously lived in his house. With the help of a neighbor, he tries to solve the mystery of their deaths before it's too late.

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Paul Walker puts the pedal to the metal in this high-octane sequel to 2001's \"The Fast and the Furious.\" Walker returns as Brian O'Conner, a cop skilled at street racing. This time out, he goes undercover in Miami to take down a drug magnate. The result: relentless action, kinetic street racing and gravity-defying car chases.

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Denzel Washington in a striking performance as 1960s boxer Rubin \"Hurricane\" Carter, who went from contender to unjustly imprisoned convict-murderer to cause célèbre when people discovered that his conviction was the result of a case built on lies. Vicellous Reon Shannon offers moving support as a teen who believes in Carter and goes the distance to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Barefoot
programme.desc: In this delightful, feel-good romance, a wealthy playboy falls for a sheltered beauty who charms his family at his brother's lavish wedding. Suddenly, the man whose life was going nowhere seems to have found the road to true happiness.

programme.title: Between the World and Me
programme.desc: An adaptation of Ta-Nehisi Coates' 2015 book, which began as a letter to his teenage son on coming of age in Black America, incorporates elements of the 2018 Apollo Theater presentation, music, animation, documentary footage and readings from the book by a long list of performers, including Mahershala Ali, Angela Bassett, Wendell Pierce, Yara Shahidi and Oprah Winfrey.

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: An ancient assassin attempts to trounce an evil conqueror by teaming up with a coalition of the remaining \"free tribes\" surviving under tyrannical rule.

programme.title: Swimfan
programme.desc: Jesse Bradford (\"Bring It On\") stars in this provocative teen thriller as a high-school swimming phenom with a bright future who gets in way over his head after a one-night stand with a budding femme fatale (Erika Christensen, \"Traffic\"). Shiri Appleby, Kate Burton, Clayne Crawford, Dan Hedaya, Jason Ritter.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The Crawley family prepares for an official royal visit to their family house in Yorkshire in 1927. They experience physical, social, and psychological upheavals as King George V, Queen Mary, and their royal entourage descend on the eponymous mansion.

programme.title: The Personal History of David Copperfield
programme.desc: This adaptation of Charles Dickens' 1850 novel focuses on the life of David Copperfield as he experiences being beaten by his stepfather and sent to work in his factory. When David's mother dies, he escapes his dreary factory life and lodges with his affluent aunt where he encounters new misadventures with eccentric characters.

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: An award-winning monthly sports journalism series with investigative pieces and in-depth profiles from across the sports spectrum.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop
programme.desc: A crack Detroit detective pursues a pal's killer through the plastic jungle of Southern California, where he tweaks authority, tumbles with the bad guys and bends the rules.

programme.title: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: A suburban ballet student moves to Chicago, where she finds a new way to express herself in the hip-hop culture of her inner-city high school and explore a new romance in this upbeat teen drama.

programme.title: Allen v. Farrow
programme.desc: One of Hollywood's most notorious scandals is the accusation of sexual abuse against Woody Allen involving Dylan, his then 7-year-old daughter with Mia Farrow. This four-part documentary series chronicles the couple's custody trial, Allen's relationship with Farrow's daughter Soon-Yi, and the controversial aftermath.

programme.title: Allen v. Farrow
programme.desc: The close-knit relationship of Farrow and Allen is torn apart by a revelation about Woody's relationship with Soon-YI.

programme.title: Allen v. Farrow
programme.desc: Mia tries to shield 7-year-old Dylan from the trauma of repeated questioning, while Allen's legal and PR teams drive a narrative that Mia is a scorned woman and unfit mother who brainwashed her children.

programme.title: Allen v. Farrow
programme.desc: Dylan and her family try to heal after the custody battle in 1993. After 10 years, she finally shares her story.

programme.title: Tenet
programme.desc: In the not-so-distant future, a special agent agrees to a risky new mission using the latest advancements in time travel and human evolution to change his present as rival nations vie for global supremacy, ushering in the threat of a third World War that could put an end to life on Earth.

programme.title: Frida
programme.desc: Salma Hayek's Oscar-nominated performance drives this fascinating biopic about Mexican surrealist Frida Kahlo and her fiery marriage to fellow painter Diego Rivera (Alfred Molina). The imaginative film also chronicles her political activism and the bus accident that left her in pain for the rest of her life. Geoffrey Rush, Ashley Judd, Antonio Banderas, Edward Norton.

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Three elderly friends and retired steelworkers are outraged to learn that their pension fund has been raided by a shady corporation. Soon, they decide to rob one of the corporation's banks to get their money back in this rousing crime comedy.

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: In Terry Gilliam's inventive fantasy, the famed authors are cast as con artists who get caught up in a real-life fairy tale involving a haunted forest where girls have been disappearing. Matt Damon and Heath Ledger star in this whimsical adventure. Jonathan Pryce, Monica Bellucci, Peter Stormare, Lena Headey.

programme.title: Any One Of Us
programme.desc: Professional mountain biker Paul Basagoitia suffers a spinal cord injury that leaves him paralyzed. This film documents his grueling journey to try and walk again, including footage of his physical therapy and traveling to Mexico for treatment. Other spinal cord injury survivors share their stories and experiences in interviews.

programme.title: 27 Dresses
programme.desc: Wedding mania gets a comic spin in the tale of Jane (Katherine Heigl), who's always a bridesmaid and never a bride. Jane's passion for all things nuptial is tested when she's asked to plan her sister's wedding to the man she secretly loves. A cynical columnist (James Marsden) who falls for Jane while surreptitiously writing a human-interest story about her further complicates Jane's dreams of love and marriage.

programme.title: Take Me Home Tonight
programme.desc: In this hilarious and nostalgic comedy, aimless MIT graduate Matt Franklin (Topher Grace) sends out the '80s with a bang after being invited to an end-of-summer bash by Tori Frederking, his former high-school crush. Meanwhile, Matt's sarcastic twin sister Wendy urges him to get his life together, and his best friend Barry displays a wild streak the size of the Mississippi River.

programme.title: High Fidelity
programme.desc: John Cusack is in a groove as the owner of a Chicago used-record store in this smart 2000 romantic comedy. It's the story of a man who reflects on his messy love life while paying meticulous attention to all things vinyl. The charmer is based on the novel by Nick Hornby. Iben Hjejle, Jack Black, Todd Louiso, Joan Cusack, Tim Robbins, Lisa Bonet.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's highly stylized revenge saga comes to a bloody good conclusion as the Bride continues to avenge her wedding-day massacre. After eliminating one enemy after another, the stage is set for an epic showdown with her former boss and lover.

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: A bomber has rigged a bus with a bomb and a cop must get on-board while it is traveling to figure out how to get the passengers off.

programme.title: A Black Lady Sketch Show
programme.sub-title: Way to Ruin the Party, Soya!

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: A girl literally comes of age in this pleasing comedy, a well-received female variation on 1988's \"Big.\" In 1987, an awkward 13-year-old girl's wish to skip adolescence is magically granted when she wakes up as a 30-year-old in 2004. Trying to adjust to her adult body and the new era, she seeks out a childhood friend for help.

programme.title: Muriel's Wedding
programme.desc: Inspired by a bold new friend, an insecure young woman—and fan of the pop group ABBA—develops a sense of self-esteem and sets out to have the wedding of her dreams.

programme.title: Chips
programme.desc: A maverick motorbike racer and a California Highway Patrol cop who's secretly an FBI operative must overcome their personality mismatch and work together to uncover a major theft in this thrilling big-screen adaptation of the famous TV series from the 1970s and '80s.

programme.title: The Trans List
programme.desc: Notable transgender individuals, including Caitlyn Jenner, Caroline Cossey, Buck Angel and Laverne Cox, are interviewed. They candidly discuss their experiences and what it means to be transgender in this fascinating documentary.

programme.title: The Comebacks
programme.desc: David Koechner (\"Anchorman\") stars as a struggling college football coach who tries to lead his ragtag team to victory while dealing with family problems in this outrageous comedy, which spoofs some of the greatest inspirational sports films ever made. Carl Weathers, Melora Hardin, Matthew Lawrence, Brooke Nevin. Directed by Tom Brady.

programme.title: The High Note
programme.desc: The overworked, overlooked, and underappreciated personal assistant to a superstar singer seizes the opportunity to revitalize her boss's languishing career - and to realize her childhood dream of becoming a music producer. Both women discover friendship and professional fulfillment amidst Los Angeles's competitive music scene.

programme.title: In Treatment
programme.desc: Brooke shares a traumatic experience from her own childhood in an effort to connect with Laila over feeling controlled by her family. As Brooke digs into her proclivity for unbridled imagination and storytelling as a coping mechanism, Laila reveals a surprising plan for her future.

programme.title: In Treatment
programme.desc: Brooke insists reuniting with Adam will not awaken destructive habits, but Rita recognizes her actions as part of a recurring pattern, and encourages her to spend more time embracing the present.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: Upon hearing the news that a huge comet will hit Earth within 48 hours and start the dreaded apocalypse, John Garrity, his estranged wife Allison, and their son Nathan decide to make their way to Greenland, where a group of bunkers is located. The journey, however, proves to be more perilous than they anticipated. Amidst the growing panic and lawlessness around them, the family tries their hardest to catch the last flight to the last possible safe haven on the planet.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Det. Mare Sheehan shoulders her chief's directive to revive an unsolved missing person's case amid increased community pressure. Later, while her loved ones celebrate her ex-husband Frank's engagement, Mare attends a celebration for her legendary high school basketball win and connects with Richard, a professor who's new in town. Series premiere.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare visits a grisly murder scene before informing the victim's enraged father. As a video from the night of the crime surfaces, Mare questions suspects in the case and gives an icy welcome to County Detective Colin Zabel, who's been called in to assist. Later, Mare bumps heads with locals and airs concerns about her grandson Drew in light of her late son's mental health struggles.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: As Mare and Colin parse new physical evidence, phone records lead to an unlikely suspect. After lashing out at Helen about a possible custody fight over Drew, Mare receives some unprompted advice from Richard on how to move forward with Carrie. Later, Kenny and Mare face the consequences of their misguided attempts to protect their families.

programme.title: Doctor Sleep
programme.desc: In this sequel to \"The Shining,\" an adult Dan Torrance befriends a young girl with similar psychic powers as himself. They join forces against The True Knot: An evil cult that exploits children with supernatural powers in their quest for immortality.

programme.title: The Book of Eli
programme.desc: Eli roams a postapocalyptic world, protecting a sacred tome that offers guidance on how to rebuild humanity in this stylish, futuristic thriller. The evil Carnegie goes to great lengths to acquire the powerful book, but Carnegie's adopted daughter, who wants to escape her dad's clutches, helps Eli.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: Upon hearing the news that a huge comet will hit Earth within 48 hours and start the dreaded apocalypse, John Garrity, his estranged wife Allison, and their son Nathan decide to make their way to Greenland, where a group of bunkers is located. The journey, however, proves to be more perilous than they anticipated. Amidst the growing panic and lawlessness around them, the family tries their hardest to catch the last flight to the last possible safe haven on the planet.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: Supremely entertaining adaptation of the Broadway hit about the ups and downs of a 1960s girl group. Jennifer Hudson won a Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role.

programme.title: The Man With the Iron Fists
programme.desc: In this outrageous martial-arts epic, a blacksmith in rural China becomes a living weapon after a war erupts, and he uses his fighting skills and the weapons he's created to defend his village from invaders.

programme.title: Dirty Pretty Things
programme.desc: Gritty, socially conscious thriller about an illegal Nigerian immigrant in London who becomes embroiled with a black-market ring selling human organs.

programme.title: The Apparition
programme.desc: In this unrelenting tale of terror, a young couple are haunted by an entity that feeds on fear following a parapsychology experiment. Desperate, they turn to a noted supernatural expert for help.

programme.title: Abandon
programme.desc: A bright college student is haunted by her past in this atmospheric thriller. Katie Burke is a driven senior at a prestigious college whose boyfriend, Embry, vanished years earlier. Katie's life unravels when a cop investigates the disappearance and Embry begins showing up on campus.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: In 1942, a few months after the infamous Pearl Harbor attack and a few years before World War II ended, the Japanese forces were once again planning to stage a sudden attack against their opponents this time near the Midway Atoll. Their plan, however, was intercepted, and the American forces arrived at the Pacific Ocean theater just in time to stop them. The battle lasted for three days, and its outcome became a critical turning point in the ongoing war.

programme.title: I Used to Go Here
programme.desc: The 35-year-old novelist Kate Conklin is still reeling from the recent breakup with her fiancé. Upon the launch of her new book, she receives an invitation from her old college professor, David, to visit her alma mater and give a talk to his students. To distract her from the breakup grief, Kate accepts and rediscovers her college, but now through the eyes of the students living there.

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: Arthur draws Excalibur from the stone in this visually stunning retelling of the legend. Later, he must learn to harness its power in order to lead a rebellion against his uncle Vortigern, who murdered Arthur's father and usurped the throne years ago.

programme.title: Presumed Innocent
programme.desc: A hard-charging prosecutor in a loveless marriage is accused of murdering a colleague with whom he had an affair after she turns up dead and all evidence points to him as the killer.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: An army of alien spaceships attack Earth and threaten to destroy the human race, but a handful of survivors band together to stop the invasion.

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049
programme.desc: In this stunning sci-fi sequel, a cop known as K hunts down android laborers who have gone rogue. But when he uncovers a conspiracy involving the robots, K searches for the one person who might have answers: a law-enforcement agent who once had his job.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding ride, a rookie CIA operative (Ryan Reynolds) goes on the run with a rogue former intelligence officer (Denzel Washington) after a South African safe house comes under attack by heavily armed mercenaries.

programme.title: Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy
programme.desc: In this riveting Cold War thriller set in 1970s England, a disgraced spy named George Smiley (Gary Oldman) is hired by his government to expose a double agent in British intelligence who is selling secrets to the Soviets.

programme.title: Eye for an Eye
programme.desc: Sally Field gives a strong performance in John Schlesinger's drama about a mother's fight for justice after her daughter is brutally killed. The film opens shockingly as Karen McCann (Field) hears her daughter's murder over the phone. The killer (Kiefer Sutherland) is set free on a technicality, so Karen takes matters into her own hands. Ed Harris, Beverly D'Angelo, Joe Mantegna.

programme.title: How to Make an American Quilt
programme.desc: During a summerlong visit with her grandmother and great-aunt, a recently engaged graduate student embarks on a journey of self-discovery—guided by the women in a local quilting circle, who offer advice and share stories of their lives.

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: Pierce Brosnan stars as a volcanologist in this action-packed thriller featuring impressive special effects. Harry Dalton (Brosnan) warns a Washington town of an impending eruption, but its residents are reluctant to evacuate...until it's too late. Linda Hamilton.

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: A rich young woman marries a poor radio announcer and finds their relationship tested on a disaster-filled European honeymoon. The couple's chemistry and the characters' outrageous antics make the film.

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: A teenager with a bright future turns his house into a brothel while his parents are away, falls for a prostitute and earns the wrath of Guido the Killer Pimp in this comedy highlighted by Tom Cruise's star-making performance.

programme.title: Lay the Favorite
programme.desc: In this winning comedy, a kindhearted Florida stripper becomes a Las Vegas cocktail waitress and forms a lucrative partnership with a professional sports gambler. But when the gambler's wife turns jealous, all bets are off.

programme.title: Kajillionaire
programme.desc: Old Dolio, the 26-year-old homeschooled daughter to a dysfunctional pair of Los Angeles scam artists, begins to question her unconventional upbringing and her identity after her parents invite a credulous stranger to participate in an upcoming scheme.

programme.title: This Is 40
programme.desc: Couple Pete and Debbie deal with marriage, parenthood and turning 40 in this hilarious semisequel to \"Knocked Up.\".

programme.title: A Black Lady Sketch Show
programme.sub-title: Way to Ruin the Party, Soya!

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: After a heroic rescue lands her in the hospital, Mare awakes to the pain of losing a friend. Then, given a second chance by Chief Carter, Mare reevaluates old suspects, which leads to a shocking clue. Meanwhile, Richard visits Mare in hopes of deepening their relationship, and Lori confides in her best friend about recent family troubles.

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: Mare's investigation takes a series of devastating turns, while her friends and family members process the fallout as she attempts to finally find her own way forward. Season 1 finale.

programme.title: Wanderlust
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, an unemployed Manhattan businessman and his wife move into a seemingly idyllic, clothing-optional hippie commune called Elysium, which may cause more problems in their marriage than it solves.

programme.title: Irresistible
programme.desc: Gary, a political strategist, thinks that the key to converting supporters for their Democratic National Committee is backing the mayoral bid of a retired US Marine in a predominantly right-wing town in Wisconsin. But when the Republican National Committee discovers this strategy, they send in their best political strategist, Faith, who happens to be Gary's long-time nemesis in the political arena.

programme.title: Rock of Ages
programme.desc: Brilliant adaptation of the off-Broadway musical about two dreamers who fall in love during the height of the hair-metal scene as they navigate the seedy world of drugs, mullets and stripping.

programme.title: Butter
programme.desc: In this gentle social satire, Laura Pickler competes against an adopted black girl named Destiny in a butter-carving competition after her champion husband can't compete. An obsessed Laura pulls out every ruse she can in an effort to attain victory.

programme.title: Sunshine Cleaning
programme.desc: A single mom struggling to make ends meet persuades her slacker sister to go into the crime-scene-cleanup business to make some quick cash. Amy Adams and Emily Blunt star in this quirky, well-acted dramedy from the producers of \"Little Miss Sunshine.\" Alan Arkin, Jason Spevack, Steve Zahn. Directed by Christine Jeffs.

programme.title: The Manhattan Project
programme.desc: A whiz kid constructs a thermonuclear device with the help of his girlfriend after stealing a cache of plutonium from the doctor who is romantically involved with his mother.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: Martial arts master Jet Li stars in this stylized action adventure from acclaimed director Zhang Yimou. The \"Rashomon\"-style epic centers on a swordsman who claims to have saved a ruthless Chinese emperor from a trio of assassins.

programme.title: One Day
programme.desc: In this touching romantic drama, a working-class woman (Anne Hathaway) and a wealthy playboy (Jim Sturgess) reunite every July 15 for 20 years. Over the course of two decades, they experience the highs and lows of life and consider becoming a couple. Directed by Lone Scherfig.

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: In this slick comedy, mobster Chili Palmer ditches the movie biz for the music industry when he decides to manage a singer.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: Supremely entertaining adaptation of the Broadway hit about the ups and downs of a 1960s girl group. Jennifer Hudson won a Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role.

programme.title: Norbit
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy is at his funniest as he plays multiple roles in this outrageous farce about a shy nerd who is married to an obese shrew, but gets a second chance to win the heart of his childhood sweetheart.

programme.title: Snake Eyes
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this highly stylized 1998 thriller directed by Brain De Palma. Cage plays a crooked cop investigating the assassination of the Secretary of Defense, who was shot at a championship boxing match in Atlantic City. As the investigation proceeds, he is forced to realizes that one of his closest friends (Gary Sinise), a Navy commander, may have been involved.

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days.

programme.title: Blackhat (?)
programme.desc: A furloughed convict and his partners hunt a high-level cybercrime network.

programme.title: Inheritance
programme.desc: After a politically influential hedge fund tycoon dies, his daughter inherits a strange cabin. She discovers that it is home to a stranger whom her father imprisoned for three decades and who possesses shocking secrets that can undermine her father's legacy and compromise the positions of her mother and brother.

programme.title: Rounders
programme.desc: Matt Damon plays a law student whose poker skills create a dilemma of choice between pursuing the law and the excitement of testing himself against the best in the world of underground high-stakes games. The scales are tipped toward the latter when the young man must aid a jailbird pal (Edward Norton) in debt to mobsters. Gretchen Mol, John Turturro, Famke Janssen, John Malkovich, Martin Landau.

programme.title: The Good Liar
programme.desc: Roy Courtnay has made a successful living as a con artist. He crosses paths with wealthy widow Betty McLeish, who seems like the perfect opportunity for an easy job. However, the deeper Roy falls into Betty's life, the deeper his emotions run for her. What he thought would be a straightforward swindle unfolds into a significantly more complicated moment in his life.

programme.title: The Presidio
programme.desc: A police detective investigates a murder at the Presidio Army base in San Francisco with the help of his former commander officer, with whom he had a dramatic falling-out years earlier.

programme.title: The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Tom Wilkinson headlines this uplifting comedy-drama about several British retirees who pool their resources to move to India, only to find that the hotel they're planning to reside at has fallen into disrepair. In time, they attempt to make the best out of a bad situation.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: A young woman (Mia Wasikowska) must come to terms with her own turbulent past after fleeing from the estate where she worked as a governess for a wealthy man in this exquisite romantic drama based on the classic novel by Charlotte Brontë. Directed by Cary Fukunaga.

programme.title: Sophie's Choice
programme.desc: Harrowing, Oscar-winning story of a Holocaust survivor from Poland, her tortured lover and an aspiring writer in Brooklyn.

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Jude Law and Gwyneth Paltrow star in this chilling adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's novel about a social-climbing psychopath. Damon is superb as Tom Ripley, a charming mimic whose obsession with a wealthy playboy (Law) turns deadly. Cate Blanchett, Philip Seymour Hoffman. Directed by Anthony Minghella.

programme.title: The Invisible
programme.desc: This superb supernatural thriller keenly and frighteningly observes a golden-boy teenager (Justin Chatwin) as he hovers between the realms of the living and the dead after being viciously attacked and left to die. Marcia Gay Harden is outstanding as the young man's controlling and emotionally distant mother. Directed by David S. Goyer, the film is a remake of the Swedish thriller \"Den Osynlige,\" which was adapted from the novel by Mats Wahl. Margarita Levieva, Chris Marquette.

programme.title: Evil Dead 2: Dead by Dawn
programme.desc: Special effects and humor blend in a sequel about teens trapped in a haunted cabin.

programme.title: Army of Darkness
programme.desc: A discount-store employee is time-warped to a medieval castle, where he is the foretold savior who can dispel the evil there. Unfortunately, he screws up and releases an army of skeletons.

programme.title: Ready or Not
programme.desc: Four college buddies find themselves on the adventure of their lives, when on the morning after a Las Vegas bachelor party, they end up stranded deep in Mexico penniless, being chased, falling in love, and fighting to make it back across the border in time for the wedding.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: Hard-drinking friends Nick (Jason Bateman), Kurt (Jason Sudeikis) and Dale (Charlie Day) plot to kill their overbearing bosses with the help of a fast-talking ex-con in this blisteringly funny black comedy.

programme.title: Death at a Funeral
programme.desc: The son of a recently deceased British patriarch copes with several crises as family and friends gather to attend the man's funeral at his country estate. Matthew Macfadyen stars in this outrageously funny farce. Keeley Hawes, Andy Nyman, Ewen Bremner, Daisy Donovan. Directed by Frank Oz.

programme.title: The Gallows
programme.desc: In this creepy horror film, high-school students restage a play that ended in horrific tragedy in order to honor the 20th anniversary of the event. However, they soon realize that their plan is a deadly mistake.

programme.title: A Good Day to Die Hard
programme.desc: In this explosive \"Die Hard\" sequel, John McClane travels to Russia to find his estranged son Jack, only to discover that he's an undercover agent working to protect an informant and expose wrongdoing in Chernobyl.

programme.title: The Rules of Attraction
programme.desc: College students plunge into a world of sex, drugs and romantic chaos in this visually innovative drama, adapted from the novel by Bret Easton Ellis. It's the story of a love triangle involving a drug-dealing student, a female classmate and a bisexual.

programme.title: Doom
programme.desc: Fans of the popular video game are rewarded with this thrilling adaptation, which follows a crack group of marines on a mission to Mars, where a genetic experiment has produced mutant monsters that are wreaking havoc on a scientific facility.

programme.title: Last Christmas
programme.desc: A dysfunctional young woman working as Santa's elf at a year-round Christmas store in London finds her life taking an unexpectedly optimistic turn after becoming romantically entangled with a handsome and mysterious stranger over the holiday season.

programme.title: Cap
programme.desc: A teenager learns the price of being cool when he dons a status symbol in his high school.

programme.title: Much Ado About Nothing
programme.desc: In this modern retelling of Shakespeare's hilarious battle-of-the-sexes comedy, a bickering man and woman are tricked into falling in love as a wedding is jeopardized by malicious rumors about the bride-to-be.

programme.title: The Dark Half
programme.desc: A talented boy who suffers from seizures grows up to become a professor and writer plagued by his homicidal alter ego.

programme.title: Cry Wolf
programme.desc: The school of hard knocks would be a piece of cake compared to this intricately plotted horror flick about a clique of snooty prep-school pranksters who start to panic after concocting a game of murder that turns into the real thing. Julian Morris, Lindy Booth, Jon Bon Jovi, Jared Padalecki, Sandra McCoy, Kristy Wu, Gary Cole, Jesse Janzen, Paul James, Anna Deavere Smith.

programme.title: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman stars in this stylized and fantasized account of how Diane Arbus transformed herself from a lonely 1950s housewife into a legendary photographer. Robert Downey Jr., Ty Burrell, Harris Yulin, Jane Alexander. Directed by Steven Shainberg.

programme.title: Wristcutters: A Love Story
programme.desc: After killing himself, a young man enters a strange purgatory and tries to find his ex-girlfriend, who has also committed suicide. Patrick Fugit and Shannyn Sossamon star in this twisted black comedy.

programme.title: The Betrayed
programme.desc: A young mother (Melissa George) learns her husband is leading a double-life as a brutal killer responsible for stealing millions of dollars from a shady corporation---and her son's life depends on how she reacts to the news. Oded Fehr.

In this flashy drama, New York's drug-and-sex-filled disco scene of the late '70s is seen through the eyes of a young man (Ryan Phillipe) whose life takes off when he obtains a job at an elite club owned by entrepreneur Steve Rubell (Mike Myers). Shane O' Shea (Phillipe) rises through the ranks from busboy to bartender and becomes a willing participant in the glitzy excess of the times. Neve Campbell, Salma Hayek, Mark Christopher, Sela Ward, Sherry Stringfield, Breckin Meyer.

programme.title: In Secret (?)
programme.desc: A woman in 19th-century Paris begins a tragic affair with her ailing husband's dashing best friend in this masterful period drama. The thought of being together all the time eventually consumes them, leading to a horrific act of violence that has devastating consequences.

programme.title: Victoria and Abdul
programme.desc: In this striking period piece, Queen Victoria forges an unlikely bond with an Indian clerk who traveled to London for her Golden Jubilee. The pair eventually become lifelong friends, although the Queen's inner circle are horrified by their relationship.

programme.title: Punch-Drunk Love
programme.desc: Screenwriter-director Paul Thomas Anderson (\"Boogie Nights\") turns romantic comedies upside down with this bizarre and provocative character study. Adam Sandler is superb as an unstable businessman who's trying to woo his sister's eccentric friend (Emily Watson) despite considerable emotional baggage. Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Lucy in the Sky
programme.desc: After a life-altering expedition into deep space, Lucy Cola, an astronaut, must return to Earth and reintegrate into everyday life. However, Lucy's cosmic experiences begin to take a toll on her connection to the real world as she spirals into a mental state that her world is too small to contain.

programme.title: Chocolat
programme.desc: An enthralling and bittersweet treat about a mysterious woman who opens a sweets shop in a French town in the late 1950s. She causes a bit of a stir, but before long, her magical concoctions have the locals eating out of her hand.

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice
programme.desc: Keira Knightley's enchanting portrayal of opinionated and spirited Elizabeth Bennet sparks this sterling adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel of love, marriage and class distinction in 18th-century England. Matthew Macfadyen costars as haughty aristocrat Mr. Darcy. Emma Thompson, who won an Oscar for Best Screenplay Adaptation for her reworking of Austen's \"Sense and Sensibility,\" did an uncredited rewrite on the script. Donald Sutherland, Brenda Blethyn, Rosamund Pike, Judi Dench.

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space.

programme.title: Duplex
programme.desc: Eileen Essell is a scene-stealing delight as a crafty old lady whose new yuppie landlords (Ben Stiller, Drew Barrymore) want her out of her rent-controlled digs. Danny DeVito directed the killer black comedy from a script by Larry Doyle (\"The Simpsons\"). Harvey Fierstein, Wallace Shawn, Robert Wisdom, Justin Theroux, James Remar, Swoosie Kurtz.

programme.title: The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Tom Wilkinson headlines this uplifting comedy-drama about several British retirees who pool their resources to move to India, only to find that the hotel they're planning to reside at has fallen into disrepair. In time, they attempt to make the best out of a bad situation.

programme.title: La La Land
programme.desc: In this wondrous musical, struggling actress Mia and aspiring jazz pianist Sebastian begin a whirlwind romance as they both pursue their dreams in L.A. However, their relationship is challenged when their careers pull them in different directions.

programme.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: In this remarkable tale, a man is born in New Orleans just after World War I, but he is already in his eighties and then proceeds to live his life aging in reverse into the 21st century, experiencing joy and sadness, loves lost and found, and the meaning of timelessness.

programme.title: Killer Elite
programme.desc: Inspired by a true story, this rollicking thriller follows former special-ops agent Danny Bryce (Jason Statham) on an explosive quest through 1980s Europe as he attempts to save his mentor by eliminating a group of assassins.

programme.title: The Lookout
programme.desc: Writer-director Scott Frank, who scripted the screen adaptations of Elmore Leonard's \"Get Shorty\" and \"Out of Sight,\" scores a winner with this gripping noirish caper saga. Joseph Gordon-Levitt stars as a bank janitor who falls in with thieves who are planning to rob his workplace. When he has second thoughts about participating, they ratchet up the pressure with threats to some innocent outsiders. Jeff Daniels, Matthew Goode, Isla Fisher, Carla Gugino, Bruce McGill, Sergio Di Zio.

programme.title: The Fighter
programme.desc: This drama depicts the incredible true story of boxer Micky Ward (Mark Wahlberg) and his struggle to emerge from under the shadow of his half-brother Dicky Eklund (Christian Bale), a former champion pugilist who lost his career to crack addiction.

programme.title: Brokeback Mountain
programme.desc: Three Oscars---for score, Larry McMurtry and Diana Ossana's script and Ang Lee's brilliant direction---went to this heartbreaking and powerful yarn about a long-running, forbidden affair between two gay cowboys (Heath Ledger, Jake Gyllenhaal). Michelle Williams and Anne Hathaway play their wives. The screenplay was based on a 12-page magazine story by E. Annie Proulx. Randy Quaid, Linda Cardellini, Anna Faris.

programme.title: I, Tonya
programme.desc: This electrifying biopic uses the format of a faux documentary to trace the rise and fall of figure skater Tonya Harding, whose career comes crashing down when her ex-husband orchestrates an attack on rival skater Nancy Kerrigan.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Guest Phoebe Bridgers chats with Ziwe about the significance of allyship for minorities. Later, the duo creates a unique game to find the most culturally relevant ally.

programme.title: The Lookout
programme.desc: Writer-director Scott Frank, who scripted the screen adaptations of Elmore Leonard's \"Get Shorty\" and \"Out of Sight,\" scores a winner with this gripping noirish caper saga. Joseph Gordon-Levitt stars as a bank janitor who falls in with thieves who are planning to rob his workplace. When he has second thoughts about participating, they ratchet up the pressure with threats to some innocent outsiders. Jeff Daniels, Matthew Goode, Isla Fisher, Carla Gugino, Bruce McGill, Sergio Di Zio.

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: When a young girl begins acting strangely, her mother seeks out a priest, who is convinced the child is possessed by a demon.

programme.title: XY Chelsea
programme.desc: This documentary spotlights the trials and tribulations of American activist, whistleblower, and former United States Army soldier, Chelsea Manning. It explores her decision to leak sensitive documents, her gender transition process, her 2017 Presidential pardon, and her reimprisonment for refusing to testify against Julian Assange.

programme.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
programme.desc: A teen vies for the affection of his high school's popularity queen, seemingly out of some deep-rooted insecurity regarding his social ineptitude. He enlists the help of his tomboy best friend and fellow misfit, unaware that she secretly pines for him.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Stephenie Meyer's romantic and suspenseful best seller that started the phenomenon comes to life in this action-packed chronicle of the modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson star. Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau
programme.desc: Rising politician David Norris (Matt Damon) battles a shadowy cabal known as the Adjustment Bureau, which has been altering time and space in order to keep him separated from a beautiful ballerina.

programme.title: Dreamland
programme.desc: A man faces a difficult choice when he discovers a beautiful fugitive.

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: Retired CIA hit man Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) and his former colleagues race to find out why they've been targeted for death by their former organization and uncover a conspiracy implicating some prominent politicians in this rousing action comedy.

programme.title: Inside Mayweather vs. Logan Paul (?)
programme.desc: A special that takes viewers inside the lives of both global superstars as they prepare for a showdown. The cameras imbed with Mayweather, a 2020 International Boxing Hall of Fame inductee, in Las Vegas as he readies himself for the exhibition bout. The cameras also follow the hugely popular Paul as he goes through a rigorous training camp in Puerto Rico and attempts to shock the world.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: Adam Sandler scores big time in this raucous remake of the 1974 gridiron classic. Sandler is a disgraced ex-NFL QB serving time in jail, where the corrupt warden orders him to put together a team of inmates to play the guards. Among his recruits is a former Heisman Trophy winner (Burt Reynolds, who played Sandler's role in the original). Former NFLers Michael Irvin, Bill Romanowski and Brian Bosworth costar with Chris Rock, Courteney Cox Arquette, James Cromwell and William Fichtner.

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: In this fascinating sports comedy-drama, baseball general manager Billy Beane (Brad Pitt) reinvents the Oakland A's by employing unorthodox scouting methods that initially make him a laughingstock in the major leagues.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus.

programme.title: Cloud Atlas
programme.desc: This wildly ambitious and deeply moving epic comprises six tales from various historical eras. An 18th-century notary goes on a sea voyage; a musician becomes an apprentice to a famous composer in 1930s Belgium; a journalist uncovers corruption at a nuclear power plant in '70s California; a contemporary publisher seeks refuge from gangsters at a nursing home; a clone escapes her job at a fast-food establishment in futuristic Korea; a tribesman struggles to survive in a postapocalyptic wasteland.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: The Coen Brothers' Best Picture winner is a mesmerizing and violent crime opus set in 1980 West Texas, where a man finds and keeps a fortune in drug loot, then tries to dodge a sheriff and a bounty hunter attempting to recover it. Based on the Cormac McCarthy 2005 best seller. The film title is from a line in William Butler Yeats' poem \"Sailing to Byzantium.\".

programme.title: Dreamland
programme.desc: A man faces a difficult choice when he discovers a beautiful fugitive.

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: A rogue pilot and his best friend team with a princess to help her save her planet when an evil space commander wants to steal all the planet's air in this \"Star Wars\" spoof.

programme.title: Hulk
programme.desc: Ang Lee directed this brooding and intense adaptation of the Marvel comic about an emotionally withdrawn and genetically mutated scientist whose alter ego---a malevolent, green behemoth---becomes a military target. Stan Lee, who co-created the comic, and Lou Ferrigno, who played the Hulk on TV, have cameos.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: A Naval Officer who slept with the US Secretary of Defense's mistress is tasked with rooting the KGB mole accused of murdering her, but realizes that he has become a pawn in an elaborate cover up to protect the murderous politician.

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: A Secret Service agent who once failed to protect JFK seeks an assassin who's threatening the President. Meanwhile, the unusually smart killer taunts the haunted Secret Service agent, who gradually begins to doubt his own abilities.

programme.title: Resistance
programme.desc: Amidst the Second World War, aspiring Jewish actor Marcel Mangel recruits a group of young Jewish Boy Scouts to work on behalf of the French Resistance to protect thousands of orphaned children as the brutal Nazi regime further encroaches upon their communities.

programme.title: Spy Game
programme.desc: Director Tony Scott puts golden boys Robert Redford and Brad Pitt through their paces in this fast-paced espionage thriller. Redford plays a CIA operative who spends his final day at the agency trying to coordinate the rescue of his protégé (Pitt), who's being held in a Chinese prison---and hung out to dry by his superiors. Catherine McCormack, Marianne Jean-Baptiste.

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 1 2 3
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as a New York City subway dispatcher who draws on his extensive knowledge of the transportation system to thwart a dangerous criminal mastermind in this explosive action thriller. Walter Garber is drifting through his daily routine when he receives word that a heavily armed gang has hijacked a crowded subway train. Led by cunning thief Ryder, the gunmen will begin executing everyone aboard should the authorities fail to deliver a sizable ransom in just one hour.

programme.title: Flatbush Misdemeanors
programme.desc: Zayna deals with a rumor she had sex with her teenage crush while Kevin deals with delivering on his first freelance painting job. Dan excitedly prepares to attend Jess's birthday party, but their worlds collide when Drew's demands impact all their lives.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: This drama charts the life of a black gay youth named Chiron as he grows up in a rough neighborhood in Miami. As a boy, Chiron is taken in by a kindhearted drug dealer and his girlfriend. Later, he risks falling into a life of crime himself.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: Ten years after we last left them, we find Bette, Shane and Alice getting on with their lives and careers, and meet Dani Núñez, her girlfriend Sophie Suarez, their best friend Micah Lee, and the charming Finley.

programme.title: Work in Progress
programme.desc: Abby begins an existential life evaluation vowing mortal consequences after 180 days. Her therapist checks out mid-session and a first date turns into a confrontation with the woman responsible for ruining her life.

programme.title: Shameless
programme.sub-title: Hall of Shame: Ian & Mickey: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: The pandemic has tested several newlyweds, including Mickey and Ian. The two needs to work on the dynamics of their relationship and relationships with other people.

programme.title: Killing Them Softly
programme.desc: In this thrilling crime drama, a professional enforcer probes the robbery of a mob poker game by three low-level thieves, but his investigation is complicated by an alcoholic hit man, incompetent gangsters and the playboy host of the game.

programme.title: Black Monday
programme.desc: Mo and Dawn negotiate their work-life balance - no holds barred. Blair makes a frienemesis.

programme.title: The Chi
programme.desc: Emmett comes clean to Tiff; a college tour forces Kevin and Jake to consider their futures; Douda makes a decision that will change the face of Chicago; Jada gets some unexpected news; Papa starts a podcast; Trig reunites with an old friend.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Guest Phoebe Bridgers chats with Ziwe about the significance of allyship for minorities. Later, the duo creates a unique game to find the most culturally relevant ally.

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 1 2 3
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as a New York City subway dispatcher who draws on his extensive knowledge of the transportation system to thwart a dangerous criminal mastermind in this explosive action thriller. Walter Garber is drifting through his daily routine when he receives word that a heavily armed gang has hijacked a crowded subway train. Led by cunning thief Ryder, the gunmen will begin executing everyone aboard should the authorities fail to deliver a sizable ransom in just one hour.

programme.title: Rambo: First Blood Part II
programme.desc: A former GI war veteran rampages through Southeast Asia hunting for POWs.

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: After losing his friend, an impetuous Navy pilot is accepted into Miramar's elite Fighter School. There, the pilot engages in a romance with his instructor while competing against a rival student flier for the program's coveted award.

programme.title: The Gentlemen
programme.desc: An American expat and self-made drug lord catalyzes a series of Machiavellian maneuvers by various players with a stake in London's underworld when he decides to sell his highly lucrative drug business, which involves cannabis farms hidden within the estates of aristocratic landlords.

programme.title: Set It Off
programme.desc: Desperate for a financial solution to their troubles, four alienated girlfriends plan a series of bank heists, growing more daring and reckless with each success. Jada Pinkett, Queen Latifah, Vivica A. Fox, Kimberly Elise, John C. McGinley, Blair Underwood, Anne Marie Horsford, Ella Joyce, Charlie Robinson, Chaz Lamar Shepard.

programme.title: Beauty Shop
programme.desc: In this razor-sharp comedy, Queen Latifah is a shear delight as she reprises her \"Barbershop 2: Back in Business\" role as sassy hairstylist Gina Norris. Gina has relocated to Atlanta and has opened her own salon, which houses a zany staff and welcomes a wacky assortment of clients. Djimon Hounsou generates romantic sparks as an electrician hoping to become the new man in Gina's life. Alfre Woodard, Alicia Silverstone, Kevin Bacon, Keshia Knight Pulliam, Andie MacDowell, Della Reese, Paige Hurd.

programme.title: Hustlers
programme.desc: A group of ex-strip club workers form a tight bond based off of their shared experience, utilizing their individual talents to outwit their wealthy clients, notably Wall Street brokers. Their journey takes inspiration from an article released in New York Magazine that rose to viral popularity.

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: A study of adolescent obsession with sex, drugs, and rock and roll has a girl seeking romance advice from an upperclassman on how to get a boy to notice her; and a stoner feuding with a teacher.

programme.title: Cloud Atlas
programme.desc: This wildly ambitious and deeply moving epic comprises six tales from various historical eras. An 18th-century notary goes on a sea voyage; a musician becomes an apprentice to a famous composer in 1930s Belgium; a journalist uncovers corruption at a nuclear power plant in '70s California; a contemporary publisher seeks refuge from gangsters at a nursing home; a clone escapes her job at a fast-food establishment in futuristic Korea; a tribesman struggles to survive in a postapocalyptic wasteland.

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: A former slave-turned-hired gun teams up with a German bounty hunter in order to free his wife from a tyrannical plantation owner in this audacious Western. However, their mission is complicated by the plantation's traitorous house slave.

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Thrilling action and Russell Crowe's Oscar-winning performance drive 2000's Best Picture, the story of a Roman general who is enslaved and forced to become a gladiator after he clashes with the emperor's bloodthirsty son.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: In this stunning crime drama set during the Great Depression, three rebellious brothers get into the bootlegging business and battle treachery on both sides of the law as they expand their operation into the big city.

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 1 2 3
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as a New York City subway dispatcher who draws on his extensive knowledge of the transportation system to thwart a dangerous criminal mastermind in this explosive action thriller. Walter Garber is drifting through his daily routine when he receives word that a heavily armed gang has hijacked a crowded subway train. Led by cunning thief Ryder, the gunmen will begin executing everyone aboard should the authorities fail to deliver a sizable ransom in just one hour.

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: An ingenious and cynical international thief---who adopts the names of saints as his aliases---feels his professional shell cracking when he steals a secret formula for cold fusion from a beautiful scientist. Val Kilmer and Elisabeth Shue star in this stylish and action-packed thriller based on author Leslie Charteris's famous spy character. Rade Serbedzija.

programme.title: Annie Hall
programme.desc: Woody Allen cowrote and directed this Best Picture, and stars as a neurotic Jewish comedian and writer recounting the roller-coaster relationship he had with a kooky, WASPish aspiring singer. The film employs fantasy flashbacks, direct-to-camera monologues, subtitles and even a cartoon sequence to tell its tale.

programme.title: Moonrise Kingdom
programme.desc: In this stylized comedy from quirky auteur Wes Anderson, two 12-year-olds fall in love at a summer camp in 1965 and run off together into the wilderness, leaving various adults and friends to search for them as a violent storm approaches.

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: The chemistry between Julia Roberts and Hugh Grant fuels this charming romance about an American movie star (Roberts) and a shy English bookseller (Grant).

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular \"Twilight\" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival.

programme.title: The Wash
programme.desc: Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre star in this crudely amusing comedy. They play car-wash workers who---between smoking and selling pot and flirting with women---somehow manage to wash a few cars, but their world is turned upside down when the owner is kidnapped. D.J. Pooh, George Wallace, Angell Conwell, Shawn Fonteno.

programme.title: Killer Elite
programme.desc: Inspired by a true story, this rollicking thriller follows former special-ops agent Danny Bryce (Jason Statham) on an explosive quest through 1980s Europe as he attempts to save his mentor by eliminating a group of assassins.

programme.title: Biker Boyz
programme.desc: Motorcycle enthusiasts should go hog-wild for this revved-up action flick. Laurence Fishburne is Smoke, president and ace rider of a biker club that engages in illegal street competitions. A young up-and-comer (Derek Luke) with a secret up his sleeve challenges Smoke to become king of the road and the race is on. Orlando Jones, Lisa Bonet, Vanessa Bell Calloway, Kid Rock.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Overweight Professor Klump invents a formula that causes him to shed hundreds of pounds instantly and transforms him into an obnoxious alter ego. Though his studly shape gives him new confidence, he soon discovers the instability of his miracle potion. A comic twist on the Jekyll-and-Hyde tale and a semi-remake of the Jerry Lewis classic. Eddie Murphy, Jada Pinkett, James Coburn.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy's delightful performances as eight characters and Rick Baker's dazzling makeup effects distinguish this sequel to 1996's \"The Nutty Professor.\" In order to get married, portly genius Sherman Klump (Murphy) must rid himself of his alter ego, the conniving and libidinous Buddy Love (also Murphy). Janet Jackson, Larry Miller, John Ales.

programme.title: Rambo: First Blood Part II
programme.desc: A former GI war veteran rampages through Southeast Asia hunting for POWs.

programme.title: The Rental
programme.desc: Two young couples rent a scenic oceanside mansion for a celebratory weekend trip. The mood becomes increasingly unnerving as they begin to suspect that their Airbnb host is spying on them – and as the secrets that they have kept from each other begin to be revealed.

programme.title: The Crying Game
programme.desc: Fergus, an IRA volunteer, assists in the kidnapping of Jody, a British soldier they hope to trade for some imprisoned IRA operatives. Fergus bonds with his hostage, and he later pursues Jody's girlfriend and begins an affair. But all is not as it seems.

programme.title: Lifeguard
programme.desc: Sam Elliott has the title role in this story of a California beachboy pondering a sea change in his lifestyle. Cathy: Anne Archer. Larry: Stephen Young. Chris: Parker Stevenson. Wendy: Kathleen Quinlan. Machine Gun: Steve Burns. Tina: Sharon Weber. Mrs. Carlson: Lenka Peterson. Directed by Daniel Petrie.

programme.title: Alex Cross
programme.desc: In this masterfully tense thriller, homicide detective Alex Cross pursues a sadistic serial killer obsessed with making his victims suffer, but the case gets personal when the killer targets Cross' loved ones.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
programme.desc: In this magical installment of the \"Twilight\" saga, Bella becomes pregnant after marrying Edward, which leads to a dangerous childbirth and a shocking realization for werewolf Jacob Black.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
programme.desc: The sweeping conclusion to the \"Twilight\" series follows Bella, Edward and Jacob as they band together to fight a group of ancient vampires who are threatening to destroy Bella and Edward's family.

programme.title: Brokeback Mountain
programme.desc: Three Oscars---for score, Larry McMurtry and Diana Ossana's script and Ang Lee's brilliant direction---went to this heartbreaking and powerful yarn about a long-running, forbidden affair between two gay cowboys (Heath Ledger, Jake Gyllenhaal). Michelle Williams and Anne Hathaway play their wives. The screenplay was based on a 12-page magazine story by E. Annie Proulx. Randy Quaid, Linda Cardellini, Anna Faris.

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: A Baltimore journalist becomes infatuated with a Seattle widower and single father when she hears him on a radio call-in show discussing and lamenting his late lost love.

programme.title: Conan the Destroyer
programme.desc: In the first sequel to the 1982 original, Conan must escort the niece of a nasty queen on a mission to find a magical gem. In return, the queen will resurrect his dead love.

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Thrilling action and Russell Crowe's Oscar-winning performance drive 2000's Best Picture, the story of a Roman general who is enslaved and forced to become a gladiator after he clashes with the emperor's bloodthirsty son.

programme.title: Inside Mayweather vs. Logan Paul (?)
programme.desc: A special that takes viewers inside the lives of both global superstars as they prepare for a showdown. The cameras imbed with Mayweather, a 2020 International Boxing Hall of Fame inductee, in Las Vegas as he readies himself for the exhibition bout. The cameras also follow the hugely popular Paul as he goes through a rigorous training camp in Puerto Rico and attempts to shock the world.

programme.title: Black Monday
programme.desc: Mo and Dawn negotiate their work-life balance - no holds barred. Blair makes a frienemesis.

programme.title: Flatbush Misdemeanors
programme.desc: Zayna deals with a rumor she had sex with her teenage crush while Kevin deals with delivering on his first freelance painting job. Dan excitedly prepares to attend Jess's birthday party, but their worlds collide when Drew's demands impact all their lives.

programme.title: The Chi
programme.desc: Emmett comes clean to Tiff; a college tour forces Kevin and Jake to consider their futures; Douda makes a decision that will change the face of Chicago; Jada gets some unexpected news; Papa starts a podcast; Trig reunites with an old friend.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Guest Phoebe Bridgers chats with Ziwe about the significance of allyship for minorities. Later, the duo creates a unique game to find the most culturally relevant ally.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: A former Green Beret wages a one-man war against police and the National Guard in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: A warrior named Conan seeks revenge on the man who killed his parents, but is tasked with helping save the daughter of a king who has come under the spell of the same man who Conan seeks to slaughter.

programme.title: Conan the Destroyer
programme.desc: In the first sequel to the 1982 original, Conan must escort the niece of a nasty queen on a mission to find a magical gem. In return, the queen will resurrect his dead love.

programme.title: I, Tonya
programme.desc: This electrifying biopic uses the format of a faux documentary to trace the rise and fall of figure skater Tonya Harding, whose career comes crashing down when her ex-husband orchestrates an attack on rival skater Nancy Kerrigan.

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: In this fascinating sports comedy-drama, baseball general manager Billy Beane (Brad Pitt) reinvents the Oakland A's by employing unorthodox scouting methods that initially make him a laughingstock in the major leagues.

programme.title: El Chicano
programme.desc: A Los Angeles police detective embodies a mysteriously masked vigilante named \"El Chicano\" to defeat and repel a violent and nationalist Mexican drug cartel that seeks to reclaim California as Mexican territory – and to avenge the murder of his brother.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: The Coen Brothers' Best Picture winner is a mesmerizing and violent crime opus set in 1980 West Texas, where a man finds and keeps a fortune in drug loot, then tries to dodge a sheriff and a bounty hunter attempting to recover it. Based on the Cormac McCarthy 2005 best seller. The film title is from a line in William Butler Yeats' poem \"Sailing to Byzantium.\".

programme.desc: David Zucker, the man behind \"Airplane!\" directed this inspired spoof of horror movies with nods to \"Signs,\" \"The Ring,\" \"The Matrix Reloaded\" and even \"8 Mile.\".

programme.desc: \"War of the Worlds,\" \"Saw,\" \"The Grudge\" and \"The Village\" are just a few of the fright flicks that are spoofed in this hysterical sequel.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
programme.desc: Lloyd Vogel is tasked with creating a profile of Fred Rogers, the creator and star of the successful children's program Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. He dutifully goes to the studio where his subject is filming his show, and soon enough, he is sitting down with him, asking him probing questions. However, Fred seems to have a different plan in mind. The interviewee suddenly becomes the interviewer, and he starts to help the writer sent for him in unexpected ways.
