programme.desc: An undisciplined man endures hardships at a Navy Aviation Officer Candidate School. He falls in love with a local woman, but risks losing everything as he clashes with his abrasive head drill sergeant.

programme.title: Lake Placid
programme.desc: When people begin to disappear at a secluded lake in the Maine wilderness in this pulse-pounding thriller, an investigative team discovers that a ferocious giant crocodile is the culprit.

programme.title: Mr. Mom
programme.desc: Family man Jack Butler is happily married and lives with his beloved wife Caroline Butler and their children Alex, Kenny and Megan in a suburb of Detroit. After he's laid off, he switches roles with Caroline.She returns to the workforce, and he becomes a stay-at-home dad, a job he has no clue how to do.

programme.title: Apollo 13
programme.desc: A chronicle of the 1970 lunar mission that suffered an explosion in space that disabled the ship, leaving the astronauts to endure the possibility of suffocation or freezing to death, as Mission Control works frenetically to devise a plan to get the men safely home. Based on actual events.

programme.title: Roxanne
programme.desc: A loquacious fireman with an abnormally large nose helps a dimwitted co-worker win the heart of the woman he himself pines for in this modern-day retelling of Cyrano.

programme.title: An Officer and a Gentleman
programme.desc: An undisciplined man endures hardships at a Navy Aviation Officer Candidate School. He falls in love with a local woman, but risks losing everything as he clashes with his abrasive head drill sergeant.

programme.title: Biloxi Blues
programme.desc: A young New Yorker is drafted and shipped off to boot camp in Biloxi, Mississippi during the waning days of World War II. The recruit is at the mercy of a near-psychotic drill sergeant who seems to have a personal vendetta against the trainee.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious weatherman finds himself reliving the same 24-hour period over and over.

programme.title: RoboCop 3
programme.desc: The cyborg defends impoverished Detroit citizens whose homes are threatened by an evil corporation formed by his creators, who have gone corrupt.

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: An ex-convict tries to go straight, but while running a nightclub his drug-addicted lawyer and an ambitious young criminal make it difficult for him to get out of the life. Meanwhile, he tries to win back the woman he loves who doesn't trust that he's trying to stay on the right side of the law.

programme.title: The To Do List
programme.desc: In this hilarious and raunchy comedy, a high-school valedictorian makes a list of sexual acts she wants to experience before college, and attempts to seek out the right guys for each task.

programme.title: Wet Hot American Summer
programme.desc: It's 1981 and the last day at a Maine summer camp, where both the counselors and the campers are looking for a good time.This hilarious spoof of the summer-camp films of the '70s and '80s features Janeane Garofalo as the chief counselor and David Hyde Pierce as the object of her affection. Written by Michael Showalter and David Wain of the sketch comedy The State. Paul Rudd, Molly Shannon, Amy Poehler, Christopher Meloni.

programme.title: Don Jon (?)
programme.desc: Unrepentant womanizer Jon earns the nickname \"Don Jon\" for his ability to charm the ladies, but harbors an emotionally crippling addiction to Internet porn until two different women teach him the true value of intimacy in this poignant comedy-drama.

programme.title: About Cherry (?)
programme.desc: In this bold and unflinching drama, California teen Angelica enters the world of fetish porn, and she attempts to maintain her innocence while working for a sympathetic adult director who wants to make her a breakout star.

programme.title: Basic Instinct 2
programme.desc: Sizzling sequel has Sharon Stone returning as icy cool seductress Catherine Tramell. This time she's in London and is being probed about her role in the death of a soccer superstar, while getting a psychiatrist (David Morrissey) all hot and bothered. Directed by Michael Caton-Jones. Charlotte Rampling, Hugh Dancy, David Thewlis, Stan Collymore. Also known as \"Basic Instinct 2: Risk Addiction.\".

programme.title: A Dog's Journey
programme.desc: Bailey is a dog that has grown old through the years who makes a promise to his owner that he will find and protect his granddaughter no matter what. As Bailey's soul jumps through multiple lives, he always finds his way to her as she goes through the highs and lows of life.

programme.title: Johnny Cash and the Ostrich
programme.desc: Frank Skinner tells the story of a 1983 incident when Johnny Cash trashed a hotel room in Nottingham in a painkiller and wine-fueled haze.Johnny Cash meets with the Hotel Manageress and regales the tale of when he was nearly killed by one of his pet ostriches.

programme.title: Volition
programme.desc: James has lived his entire life with an unusual ability of foresight and, as he ages, he struggles to cope with his powers of clairvoyance. Yet when he experiences an unsettling insight into his own murder, he strives to change the future in his present.

programme.title: Barely Lethal
programme.desc: In this action-packed comedy, a teenager who has been trained since childhood to be a special-ops assassin meets her biggest challenge yet when she tries to navigate ordinary high-school life.

programme.title: Made in Italy
programme.desc: Robert, a London-based bohemian artist, has been estranged from his adult son. They travel to Tuscany, Italy, to take care of business left to him by his late wife. He inherits a once beautiful villa, only to see it in a sorry state of disrepair. What turns out to be an initially quick trip becomes an extended stay as father and son try to repair the house, and in the process find their own way of trying to repair their strained relationship.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: The Grim Reaper comes to Earth to retrieve a media tycoon shortly before his 65th birthday, but agrees to grant him a little more time if the mogul will teach him about life's pleasures. The doomed man jumps at the chance, but doesn't foresee that Death will fall in love with his beautiful daughter.

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller about a Detroit police officer who dies in the line of duty but is resurrected as a half-human automaton and programmed to serve justice at any cost—a quest that is often at odds with a thirst for revenge on the thugs who killed him.

programme.title: Family First
programme.desc: JP tries to balance his family's needs with his criminal activities.

programme.title: Remember
programme.desc: An elderly Holocaust survivor escapes his nursing home, and embarks on a quest to execute the Nazi commandant who murdered his family. However, his mission is complicated by his advancing Alzheimer's in this stark thriller.

programme.title: Burden
programme.desc: As a museum dedicated to the Ku Klux Klan opens in his small South Carolina town, Reverend Kennedy promises to neutralize the racial tension that arises as a result of this development. Things become more difficult when his congregation finds out that he will be giving shelter to Mike Burden, an orphan raised as a Klansman who's currently trying to detach himself from the Klan. The two men find themselves in direct opposition to a cunning KKK leader, endangering their families' lives.

programme.title: Dark Waters
programme.desc: Rob Bilott is a lawyer whose specialization is defending corporate entities. One day, a farmer named Wilbur Tennant barges into his office and blackmails him into helping him sue the Dupont company for poisoning the Dry Run Creek. Rob decides to check out the situation himself, and what he sees convinces him to take on the case. His boss, Tom Terp, is supportive of his endeavor to stop the company from causing any more harm to the environment, but his wife Sarah isn't as receptive.

programme.title: The Current War: Director's Cut (?)
programme.desc: Electricity kingpins George Westinghouse and Thomas Edison find their rivalry escalating, plunging deeper into a brutal race to electrify the United States. Loyalties are tested and lines are crossed as the magnates vie to exert their influence across the nation and also bring their patented electrical system to the entire modern world.

programme.title: Rob Roy
programme.desc: Epic tale of the18th-century Scottish outlaw Robert Roy MacGregor, whose battles to protect his family from corrupt moneylenders made him a hero.

programme.title: Johnny Cash and the Ostrich
programme.desc: Frank Skinner tells the story of a 1983 incident when Johnny Cash trashed a hotel room in Nottingham in a painkiller and wine-fueled haze.Johnny Cash meets with the Hotel Manageress and regales the tale of when he was nearly killed by one of his pet ostriches.

programme.title: Made in Italy
programme.desc: Robert, a London-based bohemian artist, has been estranged from his adult son. They travel to Tuscany, Italy, to take care of business left to him by his late wife. He inherits a once beautiful villa, only to see it in a sorry state of disrepair. What turns out to be an initially quick trip becomes an extended stay as father and son try to repair the house, and in the process find their own way of trying to repair their strained relationship.

programme.title: Eighth Grade
programme.desc: In this modern coming-of-age comedy, a shy and insecure thirteen-year-old girl's social life revolves around recording chirpy self-help YouTube videos in her bedroom. Unable to heed her own advice, she struggles to break out of her shell.

programme.title: Olympic Dreams
programme.desc: It is the Winter Olympic Games and cross-country skier Penelope is a first-time Olympian. There, she meets Ezra, a volunteer dentist at the Olympic Village. After doing poorly in her competition, Penelope finds herself with plenty of time to spare until the games conclude. She begins to spend it with Ezra, and soon enough, the two become close. Slowly, they go from acquaintances, to friends, to two people who share something deeper and more intimate.

programme.title: Uptown Girls
programme.desc: Brittany Murphy and young Dakota Fanning are delightful together in this charming comedy. Murphy plays the privileged daughter of a late rock star who loses her inheritance and must go to work as a nanny to a precocious 8-year-old.

programme.title: Pieces of April
programme.desc: Katie Holmes and Best Supporting Actress nominee Patricia Clarkson head a superb cast in this touching comedy-drama. Holmes plays April, a struggling waitress who decides to invite her estranged family to her NYC apartment for Thanksgiving. She wants to reconcile with her folks, but doesn't have much time. Her mom (Clarkson) is dying of cancer.

programme.title: Liberal Arts
programme.desc: In this poignant, heartwarming tale, a thirtysomething man dealing with a midlife crisis visits his old college campus at the behest of a former professor, and unexpectedly falls for a sophomore who reawakens his sense of purpose.

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: Struggling author Eddie Morra (Bradley Cooper) overcomes his writer's block with a new drug that unlocks the full potential of his brain, and he forges a partnership with a powerful businessman (Robert De Niro) in this inventive, exciting thriller. Meanwhile, some dangerous characters discover Eddie's secret and come gunning for his dwindling supply of the pharmaceutical.

programme.title: Arbitrage
programme.desc: In this intense, topical drama, a Wall Street hedge-fund tycoon does his best to maintain a picture-perfect facade as his empire crumbles and he attempts to hide evidence of his financial wrongdoings.

programme.title: Hot Summer Nights
programme.desc: Teenager Daniel spends a summer in Cape Cod. He gets into the drug-dealing business, but gets romantically involved with his business partner's sister at the same time. During a summer that is filled with parties and arcades, tensions rise during an incoming hurricane.

programme.title: How to Build a Girl
programme.desc: Johanna Morrigan is a smart, funny, and shameless 16-year-old who is set on improving her non-existent social life. One day, her brother Krissi directs her to an ad from a London-based rock magazine that is looking for a writer. Confident in her skills, she submits her review for the Annie soundtrack and as expected, the magazine writes back and she gets the job. Soon, she undergoes a makeover and starts calling herself Dolly Wilde.

programme.title: Uptown Girls
programme.desc: Brittany Murphy and young Dakota Fanning are delightful together in this charming comedy. Murphy plays the privileged daughter of a late rock star who loses her inheritance and must go to work as a nanny to a precocious 8-year-old.

programme.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
programme.desc: Punk teen Enn attempts to crash a party in the London suburbs. He ends up at the wrong house where he encounters a kooky, conformist cult, which includes the naive Zan. They hit it off before Enn learns that she is actually a repressed alien on Earth to complete a fatal ritual. Enn appeals to the punk scene to help both emotionally and physically liberate the lady he's fallen for.

programme.title: Paradise Hills
programme.desc: Generations into the future, a strict binary divides society into two distinct classes. A superior teen girl rebels against her arranged marriage to a fellow superior, falling for an inferior instead. When her mother learns of the secret romance, she sends her daughter to a finishing school for rebellious young women.

programme.title: Jexi
programme.desc: Phil, who has an obsession with his phone, gets an upgraded model that integrates a virtual voice assistant named Jexi. Phil's life begins to change when Jexi encourages him to go out more and make friends. But as Phil becomes less obsessed with his phone, Jexi starts to make his life miserable.

programme.title: Pieces of April
programme.desc: Katie Holmes and Best Supporting Actress nominee Patricia Clarkson head a superb cast in this touching comedy-drama. Holmes plays April, a struggling waitress who decides to invite her estranged family to her NYC apartment for Thanksgiving. She wants to reconcile with her folks, but doesn't have much time. Her mom (Clarkson) is dying of cancer.

programme.title: A Dog's Journey
programme.desc: Bailey is a dog that has grown old through the years who makes a promise to his owner that he will find and protect his granddaughter no matter what. As Bailey's soul jumps through multiple lives, he always finds his way to her as she goes through the highs and lows of life.

programme.title: Inventing the Abbotts
programme.desc: The story of three influential years in the lives of the Abbott girls and the Holt boys. The girls' wealthy dad insists that his daughters Pam and Eleanor marry rich, but Pam is drawn to her friend Doug Holt, and Doug's brother Jacey pines for Eleanor. Joaquin Phoenix, Billy Crudup, Liv Tyler, Will Patton, Kathy Baker.

programme.title: Salmon Fishing in the Yemen
programme.desc: In this quirky, warmhearted comedy, a scientist going through a midlife crisis agrees to help a sheikh fulfill his dream of bringing sport fishing to the deserts of Yemen. Meanwhile, he falls in love with a young woman hired to be part of the project.

programme.title: Source Code
programme.desc: In this tense sci-fi thriller, Capt. Colter Stevens (Jake Gyllenhaal) travels back in time and inhabits the body of a male passenger on a Chicago train immediately before a deadly explosion, as part of a mission to find the terrorist responsible and prevent another attack.

programme.title: Waves
programme.desc: A suburban African-American family living in South Florida cope with life, love, and unexpected calamity. Their ambitions for happiness and success are thwarted by a career-ending sports injury and the traumatic aftermath of an unintended murder.
